VP, Data Analytics & Insights

This position will strategize and deliver the data and & analytics and insights framework at Wiley. This is a pivotal role that will have huge impact on changing academic and scholarly Research and advancing the cause of education. The work includes framework architecture, sourcing, leading, and presenting forward-thinking, high-impact Data Analytics projects focused on key strategic initiatives for Wiley and its customer segments. You will lead teams in an exciting and engaging environment, where you will be encouraged to expand your skills, test your creative boundaries, and work closely with businesses across the company to share new ideas and deliver on their projects.

This position reports to Wiley’s CTO. Our team merges the entrepreneurial spirit of a start-up with the stability of one of the world’s most established Education services companies. We operate in a fast-paced environment and need someone who takes initiative and is excited about being part of a cultural and business transformation.

The Vice President, Data Analytics & Insights sets the strategy and vision for Wiley’s approach to transformative data opportunities. The individual selected will direct Wiley’s approach to solving clients’ data-driven platform, business, and products and service needs. S/he will set the vision and quality bar of its output, and represent it in all its forms internally and externally. S/he ensure that a data-driven culture is integrated within the fabric of all of Wiley’s offerings.

On a day-to-day basis, s/he collaborates with other department leaders, data scientists/marketing science analysts, and creatives to uncover clients’ data gaps, and understand clients’ data needs and opportunities in which data could help them achieve their business objectives.

This role will work closely with our business partners every day to shape the global data strategy and vision. Determine Wiley’s unique approach to help academic and education industry clients solve their need for data-driven platforms, business opportunities, and products/services.

Responsibilities:
Lead teams from project scoping to final solution in a cross-business capability dedicated for using advanced data analytics to solve complex business problems.
Develop and maintain relationships with senior executives in the business lines. Build in-depth knowledge of the business success drivers, industry trends, regulatory issues and competitive marketplace to develop and deliver value added business solutions that have a measurable impact on results.
Drive pragmatic approaches to solving key complex business problems through data analysis, predictive modeling and machine learning techniques. Ability to bring the right data technique to solve the problem in an explainable manner to the business.
Lead verbal and written communications with colleagues and business partners at all levels to clearly articulate the approach and the findings of interpretable analytical models and assist in driving solutions.
Advise on implementation of advanced data analytics models with effective and practical short- and long-term actionable solutions within the businesses.
Grow the data and technical environment at Wiley by bringing new technologies and techniques to create efficient process around data extraction, aggregation and analytics that meet the governance and security standards of the company and reduce time to insights for the business.
Constantly hold the picture of Wiley’s cultural transformation from a product-centric to a customer-centric orientation with data/analytics emphasis, especially by improving the data and analytics environment overall while being pragmatic and agile and in synch with the needs of the business.
Create strong partnerships with various product management teams across Wiley and be a thought partner on concepts that will lead to project inceptions forming a portfolio of potential projects for prioritization by the business. Work directly with clients to identify data-related business problems.
Initiate and manage strategic external partnerships to supplement internal advanced data analytics capabilities, as desired. Manage and have a view of current and potential resource requirements, capabilities and team formations that are aligned with projects and best manage costs.
Lead the development of Wiley’s data offerings and innovation approach to data acquisition, storage and distribution.
Work with Wiley’s Chief Technology Officer to develop delivery capabilities, including business intelligence, artificial intelligence/machine learning capability, and algorithm development.
Identify Sales/marketing science/data science research needs, and drive methodology enhancements through practice excellence, partnership with the business and thought leadership.
Identify opportunities to apply advanced analytics and data science, including predictive analytics, business intelligence and cognitive computing solutions to define new products and approaches to client problems.
Using your advanced and web analytics backgrounds in R, Python, SQL, Adobe Analytics and knowledge of DMPs/DSPs to aggregate and integrate multi-channel data and predict customer behaviors based on their engagement with advertising/marketing and purchasing trends.
Present an architecture and define our build/buy strategy for our data analytics and data lake, and our approach to data science to discover data nuggets and deliver on the promise adaptive learning.
Qualifications:
Advanced degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or a quantitative discipline, plus a minimum of 10 years of relevant work experience in data analytics, market research, customer knowledge, or consulting.
Superior communication and persuasion skills; talent for storytelling, visualization and creating insights from data to deliver practical recommendations for business action.
Consultative nature, with a proven track record of using data to provide actionable business results.
Proven relationship building and collaboration skills; ability to influence and drive outcomes in large, matrixed and complex organizations.
Experience managing teams of data scientist and analytical professionals.
Accustomed to managing multiple teams on different projects. Experience managing projects, budgets and schedules to successful completion.
Experience managing and mentoring teams and challenging and influencing team leads as well as providing constant direction and feedback
Prior experience with building custom statistical models, analyzing unstructured data, and/or machine learning is highly desirable.

Entrepreneurial spirit, persistence, and resilience; comfort with and ability to thrive on and drive change while navigating ambiguity.
Experience in Education services industry experience a plus.

Join us on our exciting journey!

IQVIA is The Human Data Science Company, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward. IQVIA has approximately 55,000 employees in more than 100 countries, all committed to making the potential of Human Data Science a reality, and we are actively hiring.

Reimagine healthcare with us

The Technology Solutions division of IQVIA develops, markets, and implements healthcare-focused enterprise software applications to help life sciences customers drive their business from molecule to market.

Role Summary

As a Software Engineer with Technology Solutions at IQVIA, you’ll play a pivotal role in development and maintenance of Orchestrated Customer Engagement Lexi iPaaS platform and Nexxus ETL. In this role you will work closely with development leads, collaborate with different product development teams and be responsible for delivering on the integration use cases dictated by business and product stake holders.

Colloborate with Integration and QA teams

Updates job knowledge by learning about IQVIA products, new technologies,reading professional publications, participating in professional organization

Experience with API based integration technologies. Exposure to Mulesoft is a plus
Working knowledge of relational databases like Oracle
Capability using ETL tools and technologies
Proficiency in Microsoft .Net Technologies with a good appetite for coding using C# and Java
Familiarity with CI/CD, exposure to cloud deployment is a plus
Exposure to software development using Agile methodology
Good analytical and debugging capabilities
Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills

Job description


ANALYTICS, GO-TO-MARKET, INDUSTRY VALUE TEAM - SENIOR MANAGER


The digital revolution is changing everything. It’s everywhere – transforming how we work and play. Accenture Digital’s 36,000 professionals are driving these exciting changes and bringing them to life across 40 industries in more than 120 countries. At the forefront of digital, you’ll create it, own it and make it a reality for clients looking to better serve their connected customers and operate always-on enterprises. Join us and become an integral part of our experienced digital team with the credibility, expertise and insight clients depend on.

Accenture Analytics, part of Accenture Digital, helps clients to use analytics and artificial intelligence to drive actionable insights, at scale. We apply sophisticated algorithms, data engineering and visualization to extract business insights and help clients turn those insights into actions that drive tangible outcomes—to improve their performance and disrupt their markets. Accenture Analytics is a leader in Analytics, with deep industry and technical experience. We provide services and solutions that include Analytics Advisory, Data Science, Data Engineering and Analytics-as-a-Service.

ROLE DESCRIPTION: ANALYTICS, PRODUCTS INDUSTRY VALUE TEAM - SENIOR MANAGER

Analytics Industry Value Teams are an integral part of Accenture’s Analytics practice, partnering with our largest clients to define and enable insights-led transformation. As a Senior Manager in our practice you will help shape and sell industry specific programs, including definition of the analytics vision & strategies, redefine the operating model & talent strategy, and manage the change journey to deliver sustainable business value. You will act as the architect for our most transformative opportunities, enabling an end-to-end analytics journey by bringing the best of our Accenture Analytics organization. You will also play a key role on the leadership team – building a practice, assets, and thought leadership.

RESPONSIBILITIES:


1. Support Go To Market activities for the industry value team for the Products industries.
Work with operations and industry value teams (IVT) to schedule and define immersion sessions
Work with Operating Unit (OU) Analytics leads to define deal shape for core IVT offering
Work with OU lead to manage pipeline
2. Sales Origination & Business Development
Educate internal Accenture stakeholders about the IVT Team and offerings
Facilitate the development of “request for proposals” responses and contract development
Lead the development of businesses cases for further project sales as determined by the practice
3. Practice & Offering Management
Shape IVT assets to accelerate sales and delivery
Drive the analytics innovation agenda, including publishable thought leadership
Play an active role building a practice including capability development and recruiting
Identify and help bring into the practice talented individuals both internally from Accenture as well as externally
REQUIRED SKILLS:

General management consulting skills
Demonstrated ability to lead complex programs
Develop deep understanding of IVT offerings
Commercial deal shaping
Client Delivery & Relationship Management
Ability to interact with and influence Manager/ Director/VP
Ability to interpret the results of analytical insights and translate results to the client in business context to drive value
Able to explain complex concepts in non-technical language
Strong story-telling ability

+ Basic qualifications
YOUR EXPERIENCE: Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree
Minimum of 5-7 years of consulting experience with proven track record of making significant client impact and value creation
Minimum of 10 years of experience in designing and utilizing analytic solutions in enterprise-wide organizations with a specialty in marketing, sales, and service domains
Superior understanding of how to manage client relationship, deliver analytics value, and influence senior clients to define and expand data-driven strategies into new applications and markets
Masters level degree in a quantitative field such as statistics, econometrics in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Marketing, or Operations Analysis, PhD is a plus
Minimum of 5 years of program mgmt. and business transformation
Meet travel requirements, up to 50%
SET YOURSELF APART: Preferred Skills:

Exceptional presentation skills – ability to convey technology and business value propositions
Strong Data Management Technology background
Value based constructs
5 years of experience interacting with clients of all levels to review expected outputs, applicability to business challenges, and model measurement
Well connected with cutting-edge analytics techniques and be confident about how to apply them to generate insights and recommendations
3 years of experience guiding the data formulation process and exploratory data analysis
5 years of experience guiding and managing a team of practitioners to execute analytics solutions, both onshore and offshore
Proven ability to manage multiple simultaneous work streams and shift / adjust resources to achieve optimal results
Evidence of thought leadership in defining innovative analytics within multiple complex applications spanning marketing, risk, and cost reduction
Excellent communication skills to drive thought-provoking dialogs with senior clients
Professional Skill Requirements
Proven ability to build, manage and foster a team-oriented environment
Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment
Desire to work in an information systems environment
Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills
Excellent leadership and management skills
OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU
Your entrepreneurial spirit and vision will be rewarded, and your success will fuel opportunities for career advancement.
You will make a difference for some pretty impressive clients. Accenture serves 94 of the Fortune Global 100 and more than 80 percent of the Fortune Global 500.
You will be an integral part of a market-leading analytics organization, including the largest and most diversified group of digital, technology, business process and outsourcing professionals in the world. You can leverage our global team to support analytics innovation workshops, rapid capability development, enablement and managed services.
You will have access to Accenture’s deep industry and functional expertise. We operate across more than 40 industries and have hundreds of offerings addressing key business and technology issues. Through our global network, we bring unparalleled experience and comprehensive capabilities across industries and business functions, and extensive research on the world’s most successful companies. You will also be able to tap into the continuous innovation of our Accenture Technology Labs and Innovation Centers, as well as top universities such as MIT through our academic alliance program.
You will have access to distinctive analytics assets that we use to accelerate delivering value to our clients including more than 550 analytics assets underpinned by a strong information management and BI technology foundation. Accenture has earned more than 475 patents and patents pending globally for software assets, data- and analytic-related methodologies and content.
As the world’s largest independent technology services provider, we are agnostic about technology but have very clear viewpoints about what is most appropriate for a client’s particular challenge. You will have access to our alliances with market-leading technology providers and collaborative relationships with emerging players in the analytics and big data space—the widest ecosystem in the industry. These alliances bring together Accenture’s extensive analytics capabilities and alliance providers’ technology, experience and innovation to power analytics-based solutions.
You will have access to the best talent. Accenture has a team of more than 36,000 digital professionals including technical architects, big data engineers, data scientists and business analysts, as well as user digital strategists and experience designers.
Along with a competitive salary, Accenture offers a comprehensive package that includes generous paid time off, 401K match and an employee healthcare plan. Learn more about our extensive rewards and benefits here: Benefits.
CALL TO ACTION

Now is the time to become a digital disrupter. The opportunity is here—what’s stopping you from pursuing it?

Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).

Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.

Accenture is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

Equal Employment Opportunity

All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.

Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

Job Description

Technical Solutions Sales Director - Analytics Center of Excellence

Join us on our exciting journey!

IQVIA is The Human Data Science Company, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward. IQVIA has approximately 55,000 employees in more than 100 countries, all committed to making the potential of Human Data Science a reality, and we are actively hiring.

Reimagine healthcare with us

At IQVIA, you will have the opportunity to build your career, while helping our customers drive human health outcomes forward. We dedicate our experience, resources and reputation so that you can drive your career and choose the path that best defines your development and success.

The Technology Solutions division of IQVIA develops, markets, and implements healthcare-focused enterprise software applications to help life sciences customers drive their business from molecule to market.

Position Summary:

This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of an industry leader and have a significant impact on future growth of our Analytics, Insights and Reporting solutions. With the right analytics, our clients can achieve the impossible. As Sales Executive you will bring in-depth knowledge of; the pharmaceutical and healthcare industry, client business processes and a proven track record of delivering results the will exceed IQVIA revenue targets.

Serve as a high level consultative technology sales executive

Assure the execution of strategic account plans, including development and implementation of qualitative and quantitative metrics for achieving account success
Lead client prospecting, site presentations, negotiations, contract development and account business reviews with key stakeholders to ensure all SLA’s are being met; stays abreast of contract expirations dates and remains actively involved to secure renewals
Utilize CRM to document actions regarding planning and sales activities (ie, sales calls, customer events, opportunities, e-marketing campaigns) and shares account intelligence with internal members during account strategy meetings

Present sales opportunities to management and work with the internal departments/team members to close large complex sales

Keep well-informed of assigned industry trends, technological and process changes, new developments, services and other general information related to the assigned accounts and market scope
Recommend strategies to continuously strengthen competitive position in markets

Demonstrate a high level of personal accountability
Education & Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree
Deep understanding of the pharmaceutical market place and commercial operations processes.
Understanding of technology including analytics, business intelligence (BI) & reporting solutions.

Demonstrated success accessing client executives making solid executive presentations and developing proposals your client saw as responsive to their needs

Computer literate
IQVIA is an EEO Employer - Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled

We know that meaningful results require not only the right approach but also the right people. Regardless of your role, we invite you to reimagine healthcare with us. Whatever your career goals, we are here to ensure you get there!

We invite you to join IQVIA™.

Job ID: R1038630

What you’ll be doing...

The Technology organization is searching for a Manager to lead Big Data, Artificial Intelligence and other Innovation Forum initiatives. The manager will be responsible for developing and accelerating Artificial Intelligence initiatives by leading cross functional teams including Oath, IT, Product, Engineering, and Planning. In this role, the Manager will act as a key contributor and facilitator to identify opportunities leveraging technological investments and expertise across the technology organization as well as driving strategic cross functional roadmaps and ecosystems for the SVP.

The Manager must demonstrate deep, thoughtful understanding of the Verizon’s network technological strategy, as well as competitive trends and business drivers. The Manager will partner with VPs and Directors to share information, collaborate, define new opportunities, and leverage technology expertise in data analytics, data science, artificial intelligence, and machine learning to solve business challenges. Additionally, in this role the Manager will coordinate all activities to research and assess new opportunities so that strategy and roadmaps are stitched together and aligned to effectively carry out the company's overall goals.

The position requires an individual with experience in Network, IT, or experience with Software Defined Networks, Cloud, Internet of Things (IoT), and Big Data AI/ML. The Manager should also possess strong interpersonal skills, project management skills, and the ability to work effectively across other organizations. The position is highly visible and requires frequent interaction with VPs and Directors across the Technology and partnering organizations.

The Manager, with support from the Exec Director/Director, will oversee new initiatives, develop key action plans, identify milestones and deliverables. The manager will also provide status on the action plans and deliverables in the form of Innovation Forum briefings.

The position focuses on:
Supporting Innovation Forum sub teams including CIO/SVP, VP and Director cross organizational teams.
Working across the organization to define opportunities to leverage technology investments and create shareholder value in Big Data AI/ML, including opportunities between Oath and Verizon.
Delivering concise, compelling, data driven business recommendations on where and how modified business decisions could lead to improved business performance.
Demonstrating strong leadership and communication skills and ability to communicate with employees at all levels of the organization. Leads and develops teams of direct/indirect reports.
Managing Innovation Forums for Big Data AI and other key initiatives to be identified by senior leadership
The ideal candidate will have the acumen to handle complex situations and multiple responsibilities. This role requires high engagement, ability to build collaboration, and attention detail to connect the dots and ensure key business deliverables are met. The candidate must possess strong analytical skills and be able to interpret data and provide recommendations to the leadership team.

We are looking for a motivated, positive, self-starter who is comfortable standing programs from the ground up and identifying opportunities that help build new strategies.

What we’re looking for...

You’ll need to have:
Bachelor's degree or four or more years of work experience.
Six or more years of relevant work experience.
Even better if you have:
BS in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or related technical field; ideally your MBA.
8 or more years of experience in a relevant technical organization performing planning, development and/or program management.
Demonstration of strong technical skills.
Demonstration of strong leadership skills.
Demonstration of strong partnership and collaboration skills.
Demonstration of strong program management skills.
Demonstration of strong analytical skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with specific experience presenting information to executive leadership.
Demonstrated ability to package and sell ideas and influence across all levels of management and across organizations.
Proven ability to drive results and actions for continued improvement in meeting business deliverables, IT processes, and program management.
Ability to own issues/decisions and manage on an ongoing basis.
Ability to create action plans that lead to resolutions.
Ability to identify opportunities to streamline processes and create efficiencies.
When you join Verizon...

You’ll be doing work that matters alongside other talented people, transforming the way people, businesses and things connect with each other. Beyond powering America’s fastest and most reliable network, we’re leading the way in broadband, cloud and security solutions, Internet of Things and innovating in areas such as, video entertainment. Of course, we will offer you great pay and benefits, but we’re about more than that. Verizon is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at Verizon.

Equal Employment Opportunity

We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or Veteran status. Different makes us better.

Job Description

IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.

PURPOSE
Direct and lead the planning, oversight and implementation of the HR strategy for the Finance and Legal support function. Through strong and engaging leadership, enable a team of HR professionals to provide expertise, advice and local HR business partnering support. Be an active member of the HR leadership team and effectively support global business management teams to help drive business delivery and results.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Serve as a trusted adviser and partner to executive leader(s) and their global leadership teams.
Command an understanding of the corporate and business line strategy and contribute to that strategy by helping leaders to define and identify talent actions and strategies to drive the business forward.
Partner with HR specialist functions/Centers of Excellence to ensure delivery against strategic business imperatives and deliver solutions to meet business needs.
Lead a matrixed team of global HR professionals who provide high quality HR support and consultancy to assigned business lines.
Partner with Business Unit Regional and Global HR Business Partners as required in the design and implementation of solutions to enhance and grow the business (including organizational design and development, management and talent development, and employee engagement initiatives) in alignment with and in support of the business goals and objectives and the global HR strategy.
Sponsor and lead the implementation of local and global projects/initiatives within HR and across the business.
Support, as required activities and initiatives associated with change management involving reorganizations, mergers/acquisitions and transfers to ensure compliance with local legislation.
Provide required analytics and people reporting data to key managers to support business requirements.
Provide advice, guidance and direct support on all aspects related to people management.

Client-centric, business and solution minded with a willingness to challenge the status quo and/or management's point of view when necessary

Job ID: R1038483

Summary of Position
The incumbent will be joining a growing Global Medical Affairs Team and will be responsible for statistical activities in support of Medical Affairs deliverables with guidance and direct supervision from the VP of Global Medical Affairs. The activities include, but not limited to, designing clinical trials and/or observational studies and/or registries, preparing statistical analysis plans (SAP), planning and execute data analyses to support publications. He/she will be working collaboratively across all relevant cross-functional areas to answer important questions in rare, genetic diseases such as Fabry and Pompe diseases. Strong verbal and written communication skills are required to understand the research question, implement complex statistical analyses, as well as explain analyses rationale and implementation (in particular, details regarding the specific analysis implementation, definitions and/or output generation).

Roles and Responsibilities
The Director, Medical Affairs Statistics and Programming is responsible for:

Plan and Execute Statistical Analyses
Collaborate with Science, Clinical Research, Medical Affairs, Data Management, Translational Sciences, and Statistics to support analyses of clinical trials data for publications
Plan and perform rigorous statistical analyses in support of Medical Affairs deliverables and business-critical new research ideas
Perform statistical analyses using SAS to generate tables, listings, and figures for use in publications/abstracts/presentations as well as other internal purposes.
Explore and implement innovative statistical methods
Author SAP to define the statistical analysis specifications, data derivations, and display shells to be generated in collaboration with key stakeholders.
Ensures quality of deliverables through appropriate testing/validation and review for completeness and accuracy (including developing, documenting and implementing validation plans).
Understand ICH, GCP and health authority guidelines with regard to reporting and associated regulations and standards (including CDISC standards).
Statistical Programming Experience
Experience in statistical programming methods to support Medical Affairs including analyses using the clinical database for scientific meetings, publications, and internal decision-making (generally based on previously conducted clinical trials).
Support statistical programming needs for registries and other sources of Real World Data.
Proficiency in SAS/STAT modules that support linear models, categorical data, and time-to-event data.
Familiarity with SAS high-resolution graphics to supplement aforementioned statistical models.
Working expertise in standard macros or author specialized limited-use macros.
Experience in statistical programming methods to support Health Economics and Outcomes Research (HEOR) including analysis related to patient reported outcomes (including development/validation) and HTA/reimbursement/value dossiers, and real world studies (for example, registries).
Teamwork and Communication
Strong communication skills to understand/document the SAP requirements and explain/discuss implementation details of complex statistical analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Qualifications and Background Requirements
MS/PhD in statistics/ mathematics/ engineering/computer science/life sciences or related
discipline with at least 3-5 years of experience in statistical programming using SAS in
the biotechnology, pharmaceutical or health related industries.
Expert knowledge of statistical programming methods using SAS to solve statistical
problems.
Experience in executing statistical analysis by authoring parts of and/or providing significant input into SAPs, implementing SAPs using SAS, ensuring quality via validation, and explaining implementation details to technical and non-technical audiences.
Experience in statistical programming methods as it relates to the following areas:
Medical Affairs analyses using the clinical database for scientific meetings, publications, and internal decision-making (generally based on previously conducted randomized clinical trials and data collected in registries).
Health Economics and Outcomes Research analyses including analyses related to patient reported outcomes (including development/validation), HTA/reimbursement/value dossiers, and real world studies.
Experience in rare diseases is a plus [Insert Professional Work Experience]

Company Description
Ralph Lauren Corporation (NYSE:RL) is a global leader in the design, marketing and distribution of premium lifestyle products in four categories: apparel, home, accessories and fragrances. For 50 years, Ralph Lauren's reputation and distinctive image have been consistently developed across an expanding number of products, brands and international markets. Position Overview
Analyst - Digital Commerce Analytics, analyzes business trends, digital transactions, social & customer behavior data to identify opportunities to enable us to lead by leveraging digital opportunities. Support reporting & analytical needs like building Metrics/KPI’s, operational insights & dashboards to enable various business processes and perform deep dive analysis to identify business issues / causes like dip in conversion or other KPI’s leveraging analytical solutions.

For this role the Analyst will quickly understand an existing digital Eco-System which incorporates both internal and external sources & systems. The Analyst will work with relevant stakeholders to capture requirements, analyze and design solutions, develop and test new capabilities. Successful candidates will also be able to follow a disciplined approach (Agile & DevOps) in managing work & communicating effectively and following established IT guidelines (security, project processes, etc.). As a Ralph Lauren analyst you will be a part of a growing Data & Analytics community that is Global in scope, and operates across all of Ralph Lauren’s regions & business disciplines.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Partnerships:
Build and foster relationships with key internal users and become a trusted resource & provider of analytics.
Proactively build relationships by being solution oriented and focused on commitments.
Prepare relevant insights and documents to assist in presenting finding to all levels of management.

Research and analyze business trends, internal data, external data (social, other) & customer behavior data to identify opportunities & propose solutions focused on digital commerce channels.

Identifying process improvement opportunities. Streamline data, metric & reporting production processes to enable analytical maturity and highly focused on continuously improving Information Quality.
Identifying day-to-day reporting issues due to gaps in our data & systems landscape and working to resolve these with various IT & business partners.
Support moving away from manual / ad-hoc analysis (using Excel, Access, other sources) to foster improved usage/adoption of enterprise analytical solutions

Analytical:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills., with the ability to use storytelling to influence decisions
Demonstrable experience in building predictive models and algorithms using real-time data / products
Comfort with data analysis & management, and associated tools in an IT landscape
Experience with process mapping and or data visualization
Experience working in eCommerce, understanding online fundamentals a plus
Communication& Relationships:
Detail oriented with strong organizational skills.
Solid interpersonal skills
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks and projects, to prioritize, and adapt to a changing environment.
Strong sense of accountability and Leverage Agile/Dev-Ops processes to manage work and communicate effectively

5-7+ years relevant technologist experience in Data & analytics, business consulting, finance or similar role
Hands-on skills in data analysis and enabling business insights (from various informational sources)
Intermediate Analytics skills including using data visualization (Power BI, Tableau, MicroStrategy, Spotfire, etc.)

Job Description
This role reports into the Director of Global Customer Intelligence of Customer Care and is responsible for quantitative data analysis and visualization. By combining a deep understanding of business concepts with knowledge of statistics and exploratory data analysis, you will uncover actionable insights and catalyze change for your internal customers, as well as Audible listeners. Your analyses may take the form of root cause analysis, impact assessment, Voice of the Customer deep dives, and more – all with the goals of building a better product, reducing cost, increasing efficiency, and ultimately improving customer experience.

This role involves developing strong relationships with key cross-functional partners and building a deep knowledge of Customer Care as well as our business in general. We seek a proactive and collaborative individual who can thrive in a culture that promotes empowerment, finding solutions, and having fun along the way.

You understand the complexities of a fast-paced, global organization and can handle multiple, abstract projects while dealing with constant change. You have a strong desire to achieve results and continuously raise the bar. You are customer obsessed and excited by the thought of driving product, process, and technology improvements with data.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Data analysis – Obtain, manipulate, and analyze data to answer specific or open-ended questions, utilizing statistical approaches where applicable, and distill actionable insights
Data visualization – Understand requirements, gather data from various data sources, conduct business analysis, and provide quantitative insights through presentations, reports, and dashboards
Root cause identification – Understand Customer Care’s business processes, identify root causes to business problems using data, and make recommendations
Best practices – Recognize, develop, and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: automation, data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation
Up to 5% of Domestic and International travel

BA/BS in Engineering, Business Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field
3-5 years’ relevant work experience applying analytical skills
Solid understanding of data concepts (databases, schemas, warehousing, ETL, data quality, etc.)
Experience with complex data gathering and analysis (e.g. SQL, R, Excel)
Experience with programming / scripting languages (e.g. R, Python, Bash, Powershell)
Familiarity working in Linux / Unix environments through Command Line Interfaces
Experience creating and sharing data visualizations (e.g. Tableau, MicroStrategy)
Working knowledge of statistical concepts (distributions, hypothesis testing, confidence intervals) and experience applying to real-world applications
Ability to analyze and interpret a mix of qualitative and quantitative data, construct compelling narratives, and provide recommendations on complex topics
Self-starter: capable of taking initiative and driving progress with minimal direction
“Lifelong learner” mentality: eager to learn anything necessary to deliver value
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build trust and partnerships with key stakeholders
Experience working with and communicating to senior managers and executives
Preferred Qualifications

Experience with Redshift SQL and NoSQL databases like DynamoDB
Familiarity with utilizing resources from the AWS family of technologies (e.g. EC2, S3, EMR)

Short Description

This position primarily provides administrative and analytical support for the Vice President and Assistant Vice Presidents of Ambulatory Operations. Basic analytical support, database creation and maintenance will be required. Extreme attention to detail necessary.

Must be able to interact with executive level staff in a professional and collegial manner.

The Data Analyst is responsible for data collection, storage, and analysis. The Data Analyst will aggregate data from institutional and external sources to create a master database(s) that can be queried and geo-mapped. Strict adherence to security protocols and HIPAA compliance is a critical part of this work and the Data Analyst will work to ensure that all data are securely transmitted and stored.

The Data Analyst will keep the database(s) up-to-date and work with partners to collect and integrate incoming datasets. The Data Analyst will work with the leadership team and collaborating departments/institutions to conduct analyses. The Data Analyst will be encouraged to find creative ways to use quantitative analyses to illuminate trends and patterns in the data, as well test real-life hypotheses.

The Data Analyst will demonstrate the ability to present information in a concise and effective manner; as well as the ability to work as a team player and collaborate effectively with others.

The Data Analyst will exhibit a high level of initiative, accuracy and self-direction. They must be able to work efficiently when there are competing priorities and communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.

Special Requirements

Scheduled Days / Hours: Monday - Friday 8:00AM - 5:00PM

Education:

Bachelor’s degree in economics, business administration or statistics or similar quantitative experience preferred or combination of education and experience.

Experience:

.one to three years experience

Proven ability to analyze data and display results creatively;

Experience managing and administering a database;

Demonstrated expertise with Microsoft Excel (macros a plus), Word, Powerpoint and Outlook

Required License/Certifications/ Registration:

Other Qualifications:

A keen interested in health care analytics;

Knowledge of process improvement preferred.

Excellent organizational skills, oral and written communication skills with strong analytical and follow-through skills. Ability to multi-task and prioritize. Must be able to work independently.

Computer literate, expert Microsoft Office skills; knowledge of Epic EHR preferred.

The CIB Technology Strategy and Governance team is a cross-CIB Technology function which is looking to drive integration in CIB Technology’s structure and to ensure greater consistency in how performance is measured in alignment with Business & Technology strategy. The group supports CIB Technology leaders with development of their workforce strategy and supporting change management activities based on operating principles aligned to primary business drivers (technology, target operating model / transformation, controls / operations and productivity initiatives) as a basis for a management framework to drive execution and enable clear communication to key stakeholders (including our staff).
The Workforce Strategy and Governance function is organized around 5 key dimensions; Organizational design, Location Strategy, Real Estate strategy, Inter Affiliate Services, Talent & Capability.
POSITION SUMMARY:
The Workforce Strategy and Governance team is seeking a data analyst to assist in collecting and analysing headcount and location data to identify important Workforce trends for the Corporate and Investment Bank. The analyst will be a member of the team that provides CIB Technology with governance, direction, thought leadership and guidance to business and functional leads on planning, development and implementation of workforce strategy initiatives, ongoing data analysis, modelling and forecasting support and briefings pertaining to the organizations workforce and any opportunities to optimize the organization.
We are currently seeking a candidate who will partner closely with the lines of business and the associated support teams to drive and coordinate the planning strategies necessary to the development of cohesive location strategy plans and organizational design. Will also provide governance, direction, thought leadership and guidance to business and functional leads on planning, development and implementation of location strategy initiatives. The candidate will work directly for the CIB Location Strategy/ COE Lead and have regular engagement with senior management of CIB Technology and its sub Lines of Business (LOB), Finance & Business Management, Global Real Estate functions and other CIB lines of business.


Responsibilities:
The analyst will facilitate workforce analytics by assisting our clients with the following:
Provide analysis and understanding of workforce data to facilitate strategic decision making,
Headcount reporting and analysis in order to establish location specific controls and the ongoing monitoring of headcount to ensure alignment to Location Strategy principles and objectives
Analytics and reporting around the quarterly Corporate Location Strategy submissions
Analytics on the composition of teams in CIB Technology (e.g. size, locations and function)
Historic headcount data trends at a city and functional level
Develop reporting by implementing a defined analytics approach along with a standard look and feel for all reporting across the Workforce Strategy Program
Develop a standard set of location and headcount reporting, act as a central point for all workforce data requests and tactically automate and work to establish a strategic solution for all repeatable data requests
Aggregate and synthesize data from authoritative systems into metrics and analytics
Design models, and provide data for workforce planning and forecasts to facilitate recruitment
Communicates data insights and makes recommendations through presentations and spreadsheets in a clear and concise manner for senior leadership
Adhoc presentations to facilitate senior leadership reviews, deep dives or offsite materials
Develop a reporting database to track seating supply and forecasted demand
Ongoing tracking of space constrained locations to provide transparency into gaps to seating allocations
Monthly collation of metrics use for management reporting
At least 2 years of specialized, hands-on experience in using Excel, Tableau or other analytical tools to conduct statistical data analysis
Strong math (statistics) skills & excellent analytical aptitude
Extensive advanced Excel skills
Extensive advanced Access database skills
Advanced PowerPoint skills
The analytics analyst should have a strong understanding of Finance and Business management resource databases and systems
Ability to synthesize large amounts of data and identify key trends
Ability to present data in a logical, concise manner
Experience in applying statistical methods
Background and knowledge of finance policies, processes, and procedures
Knowledge of database integrity and security standards
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Direct client support experience in a fast-paced environment
Effective multi-tasking skills
Our Corporate & Investment Bank relies on innovators like you to build and maintain the technology that helps us safely service the world’s important corporations, governments and institutions. You’ll develop solutions for a bank entrusted with holding $18 trillion of assets and $393 billion in deposits. CIB provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk, and extends liquidity in markets spanning over 100 countries around the world.

When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.

At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.

Job Description:

PLEASE BE ADVISED THAT MERRILL LYNCH DOES NOT OFFER SPONSORSHIP FOR VISA PETITIONS OR OTHER WORK AUTHORIZATION, NOR WILL THE COMPANY PROVIDE RELOCATION ASSISTANCE, FOR THE POSITION.

Merrill Lynch Wealth Management is a leading provider of comprehensive wealth management and investment products and services for individuals, companies, and institutions. Merrill Lynch wealth management is one of the largest businesses of its kind in the world specializing in goals-based wealth management, including planning for retirement, education, legacy, and other life goals through investment advice and guidance.

Merrill Lynchs financial advisors help clients pursue the life they envision through a one-on-one relationship with an advisor committed to their needs. We believe trust comes from transparency. Our trusted financial advisors are equipped with access to the investment insights of Merrill Lynch coupled with the banking convenience of Bank of America.

The Position:

The MLWM Business Oversight and Supervision Business Intermediate Quant Analyst is responsible for the analysis and development of business and risk intelligence tools and frameworks for MLWM Business Oversight and Supervision. This role is responsible for designing and implementing analytical tools and predictive models based on that intelligence, creating efficiencies in leveraging existing reporting data / tools, and identifying analytics and dashboards that can mitigate and manage Supervisory risk. Other responsibilities of the this role include developing analytics for risk mitigation opportunities, as well as identifying, monitoring, and communicating trends and implementing recommendations based on those trends / analysis in support of achieving goals in line with business strategy.

Key Responsibilities:
Work with and coordinate with Supervision team members, Model Risk Management, Compliance, Risk and Audit to build sophisticated models, determine proper empirical methodology, organize data collection, write unique programs, prepare written reports, and summarize the results of analytic studies in formal and informal presentations.
Design, develop, test, and implement advanced predictive models and risk analytics tools utilizing data from Supervision, Compliance, and other key partners across GWIM.

Optum combines data, technology, and expertise to power modern health care. The Data&Advanced Analytic Tools Consulting team drives the adoption and use of Optum's data assets and technology solutions in the Life Sciences industry.

Optum's industry-leading data assets include clinically-robust Electronic Health Record (EHR) data spanning the care continuum (from the legacy Humedica business), eligibility-controlled affiliate and non-affiliate insurance claims data, a new class of deterministically-linked Integrated EHR and claims data, and linked profile data including socio-economic information and health risk assessments (HRAs). Optum's data assets enable our clients to enrich their view of the patient and the patient journey through the healthcare system, serving needs across a spectrum of functional areas including real world evidence, health economics and outcomes research, safety and surveillance, epidemiology, and product commercialization.

Optum's advanced analytic tools empower our clients to harness intelligence from these data assets with scale. Optum's suite of tools include NorthStar, an application that reveals how the patient's clinical presentation impacts treatment choice, Clinformatics for Managed Markets, an application that assesses the effect of plan design and patient cost-sharing on drug utilization, Clinformatics for Clinical Trials, an application that optimizes clinical trial recruitment, and a next generation set of advanced analytic applications designed for a platform ecosystem, including a patient journey module.

Our wealth of data and tool solutions, combined with our industry expertise, is uncovering novel insights and driving real world change.

We're now looking for a dynamic Senior Consultant to support Data&Advanced Analytic Tools, working closely with our clients across the industry.

This consulting team manages, grows, and develops relationships with research, scientific, and commercial leaders at life sciences companies through the use of Optum's data assets and technology applications.

The Senior Consultant is expected to support the Director and Commercial Analytics Leads, serving as the primary point of contact for a collection of clients, including providing on-site analytic support services. The Senior Consultant should become an expert in the contents and uses of Optum Life Sciences' data assets. Success in this role requires: (a) the ability to engage and educate clients and prospects about the assets and capabilities of Optum Life Sciences; (b) creativity to identify and frame specific, even novel, responses to the client's request; (c) comfort leading cross-functional projects inside a matrix and geographically dispersed organization; and (d) collaboration with sales professionals and other Optum colleagues who may be pursuing or serving the same companies.

The Senior Consultant must have superior communication skills, including proposal and report writing, presentation development and delivery, and inquiry and direction for internal operations, project execution, and business development.

Primary Responsibilities:
Support and develop client relationships: listen, understand, and articulate client needs
Serve as commercial analytics subject matter expert on data and analytics to support data, business intelligence applications, and analytic sales
Solve unique and complex problems with broad impact on the business
Partner with internal team members on cross functional client engagements
Develop case studies and business proposals
Participate in the development of business strategy
Predict emerging client commercial analytics needs and participate in the development of innovative solutions to meet those needs
Interact with other departments, such as sales, operations and client services, to ensure a high level of client satisfaction through successful execution of projects and use of applications and data
Work closely with Product Development and other entities within the Optum family of companies to support product improvements and new product offerings
Provide thought leadership on new ideas and interface with clients to obtain feedback
Motivate, recruit and train members the team
Expect 30% business development, 70% strategic, consultative support for data and tools
Ability to travel up to 50%, but location is flexible. Travel to the client site is necessary and would vary by project and location.

To be considered for this position, applicants need to meet the qualifications listed in this posting.

Required Qualifications:
Must have experience managing projects with Pharma clients, preferable in the healthcare commercial space
Bachelor's degree with at least five years of professional experience (or graduate degree with at least 3 years), in the life sciences industry, healthcare field, or management consulting
3 years' experience consulting in an external client facing role or internal consulting role supporting engagements or large projects
Experience leveraging patient-level healthcare data (claims, EHR, etc.) to support commercially oriented business questions such as forecasting and segmentation
Must have experience managing projects with Pharma clients, preferable in the healthcare commercial space
Experience developing new business and identifying add-on work
Excellent writing and presentation skills
Travel required 50%
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working in a Big 5 or large consulting organization is preferred
Advanced degree (MBA, MS, PhD)
Demonstrated ability to consult with clients on how to effectively use data to achieve business objectives
Project Management
Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world?s large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.SM

Title
Director- Cyber Security & Information Management

23-Aug-2018

17-Aug-2019

Primary Responsibilities
Leads a team of managers responsible for cyber security, information governance, business Intelligence and other related activities in support of business objectives and strategy.
Works closely with customers to develop and execute an overall data strategy and roadmaps for the company.
Overall responsibility for Cyber Security policies and procedures, which requires staying abreast of IT Security trends and best practices, and incorporating them into policies and procedures, as appropriate.
Ensures development, implementation and monitoring of necessary controls and procedures to effectively protect information technology assets from intentional or inadvertent modification, disclosure or destruction.
Develops and provides oversight of the tools and processes for the identification of data sources, and efficient and error free retrieval of information from our digital systems.
Leads the overall process for information governance within the company including facilitation of associated committees, procedure oversight and stewardship.
Leads the cyber security team, responsible for overall cyber security governance, architecture risk assessment and oversight.
Leads the business intelligence and data architects who are responsible for warehousing of PPL Electric Utilities digital data, and building reports and integration tools to make it more accessible to customers.
Leads a team of centralized data scientists responsible for providing analytics capabilities for corporate projects as well as standard tools and procedures for analysts throughout the companies.
Effectively communicates with clients, peers, and interdepartmental management in business matters involving cyber security and information.
Ensures that the organization has the appropriate tools, processes and people so that data is used securely, efficiently and effectively throughout the organization.
Relentlessly pursues new opportunities to learn from system problems, improve performance, and provide new opportunities to use data in ways that improve performance of the grid at a lower cost.
Responsible for the overall budget and cost performance for the Cyber Security and organization, serving as a steward for the company's investments in this domain.
Provides appropriate and timely feedback to staff and ensures the appropriate development of strategic, leadership and technical skills within the area of responsibility.
Works with Supply Chain to lead for the origination and administration of technical contracts within area of responsibility.
In-person supervision of employees to ensure compliance with FLSA wage and hour issues as well as to monitor compliance with safety rules.
Physical presence in the office/on-site to engage in face-to-face interaction and coordination of work among direct reports and co-workers.
May be assigned an Electric Utilities emergency and storm role. This is a special assignment that comes into play during storms and other emergencies when the company needs to restore power or respond to other issues affecting customer service. This role may necessitate the need to work after-hours, outside of your normal schedule.
Requisition ID
4472BR

Position Summary
Position located in Allentown, PA or Washington, D.C.

Reporting to the CIO, this senior leadership position has the responsibility for the overall management and strategic direction in both cyber security and information management for PPL Electric Utilities. Key functions include oversight of PPL Electric Utilities overall cyber security strategy, policies and investment plan, as well oversight of enterprise data governance, data tool selection and data architecture. This position has ultimate accountability in leading the charge to enable a future that improves our cyber security posture while also leveraging data to enable improved experiences for our employees and our customers.

Corporate Summary
As one of the largest investor-owned companies in the U.S. utility sector, PPL Corporation delivers on its promises to customers, investors, employees and the communities we serve. Our utilities – Western Power Distribution, Louisville Gas and Electric and Kentucky Utilities, and PPL Electric Utilities – provide an outstanding service experience for our customers, consistently ranking among the best in the United States and the United Kingdom. PPL has grown from a company with customers and facilities in one region of Pennsylvania to a diverse energy company with more than 10 million customers in the U.S. and the U.K. PPL provides energy for millions of customers while providing challenging and rewarding careers for thousands of employees around the U.S. and abroad. Description:
Business Data Analyst
Experience with HFM and Client
Hyperion is a plus
Busness analyst supporting the Hyperion Project Implementation project team members and leadership for the purposes of leading the financial data conversion and validation strategies for the project.
A successful candidate will be able to analyze data while understanding the needs of finance and accounting managers, from a data conversion, reconciliation and data validation perspective.

Sr Business Analyst - Financial Data Lead will leverage existing financial systems and database tools to provide clear actionable data validation and data conversion strategies.
The Sr Business Analyst - Financial Data Lead will have strong data analysis skills, advanced Excel skills, and exhibit strong creative and problem-solving skills, and collaborative abilities. This position requires proficiency in data analysis, knowledge of financial systems, as well as strong analytics aptitude and the ease/ability to communicate with project leadership and senior management as applicable. The Sr Business Analyst - Financial Data Lead, will play an active role in the problem-solving aspect of engagements, and complete project tasks within scope and budget in accordance to KPI's.
Assist in creation of data conversion, mapping and data validation strategies and approach. Develop and maintain project deliverables, including but not limited to data conversion and mapping tables and data validation reports. Knowledge of data conversion and mapping tools is required.
Develop customized data validation analytical reports and spreadsheets for comparison from legacy financial system to new financial applications. Create complex multi-dimensional data validation spreadsheets to validate mutliple sources of data against one another. Assist with troubleshooting data conversion, mapping & validation out of balance items.
Provide analytical insight of monthly financial results comparatively between systems. Be proficient with multiple financial systems overall architecture to adequately navigate analytical activities.
Collaborate with internal staff to identify & remedy reconciliation issues for Income Statement and Balance Sheet. Advance knowledge of accounting and finance data is required for the purposes of troubleshooting out of balance items.
Assist with due diligence and financial data testing, validation and sign off for all data strategies/tracks.
Create and lead the efforts for company financial audit, evidence and sign off compliance materials regarding data validation and testing.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree, preferably in Finance or Business, or similar
Experience with building functional, data driven spreadsheets/reports for data conversion, mapping & data validations for real-time testing
4 years' experience in an analytical capacity building financial reporting & spreadsheets
Detail oriented with strong quantitative skills and strong knowledge of financial analysis and data validation techniques
High degree of proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Excel Guru, including building and modifying complex pivot tables and macros for reporting
Highly motivated, self-starter who manages projects end-to-end and has a demonstrated track record of getting results, organizing and prioritizing deadlines
Experience in aggregating and integrating data points for functional analysis within financial reporting
Commitment to work in a team-based environment and acceptance of multi-directional feedback
Demonstrated ability to drive continuous improvement and solve problems while collaborating with stakeholders on their needs
Aptitude for system automations and streamlining processes
Team-oriented and positive attitude supporting monthly, quarterly and annual reporting
Provide data, analyses, modeling, and reporting to support financial data reviews and sign -offs Analyze trends and variances to goals and communicate to managers.
Support ad-hoc data analysis requests
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of Hyperion FDMEE, HFM & Planning financial systems
Experience managing finance systems related projects
Experience in Retail and/or Consumer Product Goods
Experience managing projects that included several complex integrations

Overview

Founded in 1908, CIT (NYSE: CIT) is a financial holding company with approximately $50 billion in assets as of Dec. 31, 2017. Its principal bank subsidiary, CIT Bank, N.A., (Member FDIC, Equal Housing Lender) has approximately $30 billion of deposits and more than $40 billion of assets. CIT provides financing, leasing, and advisory services principally to middle-market companies and small businesses across a wide variety of industries. It also offers products and services to consumers through its Internet bank franchise and a network of retail branches in Southern California, operating as OneWest Bank, a division of CIT Bank, N.A. For more information, visit cit.com.

Responsibilities

The Analytics Data Architect will serve as the lead architect and expert for data architecture and business intelligence/analytics-based solutions for the CIT enterprise data management team. This individual will deal with complex, interrelated applications and systems, and will work with technologies and internal stakeholders to analyze and define solutions for achieving strategic business goals. The Analytics Solution Architect will be responsible for the architecture, design, and tool selection for the data ingestion, data transformation and data access capabilities in the CIT enterprise data program.

The Analytics Solution Architect role will design the end-to-end enterprise data platform which will be used to support the enterprise BI/analytics requirements across multiple parallel sourcing and reporting implementations, including the expansion of the existing program to meet additional business needs as well as the extension of the architecture to support advanced analytics/data science needs across the corporation. This role will be expected to actively participate in defining and governing our data management strategy for CIT, as well as being an advocate for and implementer of best practices in data management on our data analytics projects. This individual will be a critical contributor to CIT’s enterprise Data Management organization, and this position will be based in the CIT headquarters in Livingston, NJ.

Qualifications

• 5+ years of experience as a technology solution leader designing and developing enterprise data architecture, Business Intelligence, and Analytic capabilities • 3+ years of relevant technology management experience with enterprise data management programs as well as managing senior level individuals, in a multi-line business environment• Ability to communicate effectively with technology experts in various computing domains (BI, analytics, SOA, BPM, data warehousing)• Experience with enterprise Data Virtualization technologies, include implementation experience with Denodo• Strong understanding in DQ, metadata, & reference/master data management• Experience in designing and developing high-volume mission critical transactional data integration solutions• Strong, in-depth experience in data modeling and experience with business intelligence systems (dimensional modeling, data mining, predictive analytics)• Ability to recognize and implement common data patterns and best practices• Ability to create a productive environment that promotes initiative, innovation, and continual improvement• Strong leadership, communication, and management skills• Master’s Degree (or equivalent work experience) in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or related field

Overview
Founded in 1908, CIT (NYSE: CIT) is a financial holding company with approximately $50 billion in assets as of Dec. 31, 2017. Its principal bank subsidiary, CIT Bank, N.A., (Member FDIC, Equal Housing Lender) has approximately $30 billion of deposits and more than $40 billion of assets. CIT provides financing, leasing, and advisory services principally to middle-market companies and small businesses across a wide variety of industries. It also offers products and services to consumers through its Internet bank franchise and a network of retail branches in Southern California, operating as OneWest Bank, a division of CIT Bank, N.A. For more information, visit cit.com.

Responsibilities
The Analytics Data Architect will serve as the lead architect and expert for data architecture and business intelligence/analytics-based solutions for the CIT enterprise data management team. This individual will deal with complex, interrelated applications and systems, and will work with technologies and internal stakeholders to analyze and define solutions for achieving strategic business goals. The Analytics Solution Architect will be responsible for the architecture, design, and tool selection for the data ingestion, data transformation and data access capabilities in the CIT enterprise data program.

The Analytics Solution Architect role will design the end-to-end enterprise data platform which will be used to support the enterprise BI/analytics requirements across multiple parallel sourcing and reporting implementations, including the expansion of the existing program to meet additional business needs as well as the extension of the architecture to support advanced analytics/data science needs across the corporation. This role will be expected to actively participate in defining and governing our data management strategy for CIT, as well as being an advocate for and implementer of best practices in data management on our data analytics projects. This individual will be a critical contributor to CIT’s enterprise Data Management organization, and this position will be based in the CIT headquarters in Livingston, NJ.

Qualifications
• 5+ years of experience as a technology solution leader designing and developing enterprise data architecture, Business Intelligence, and Analytic capabilities
3+ years of relevant technology management experience with enterprise data management programs as well as managing senior level individuals, in a multi-line business environment
Ability to communicate effectively with technology experts in various computing domains (BI, analytics, SOA, BPM, data warehousing)
Experience with enterprise Data Virtualization technologies, include implementation experience with Denodo
Strong understanding in DQ, metadata, & reference/master data management
Experience in designing and developing high-volume mission critical transactional data integration solutions
Strong, in-depth experience in data modeling and experience with business intelligence systems (dimensional modeling, data mining, predictive analytics)
Ability to recognize and implement common data patterns and best practices
Ability to create a productive environment that promotes initiative, innovation, and continual improvement
Strong leadership, communication, and management skills
Master’s Degree (or equivalent work experience) in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or related field

The position functionally reports into Global Facilities Information Management Lead supporting client Global Real Estate Services.

This role involves the collection and maintenance of facility data for all owned and leased client sites (currently estimated at 700+ locations), including but not limited to cost, capacity and occupancy data.

All data will be entered into and maintained in Manhattan CenterStone - the client's Integrated Workplace Management System (IWMS), by this role or by related team roles using predefined templates.

Maintains Master floor plans and as-built furniture plans using CAD to capture post-move space reconfigurations.

Through use of IWMS and CAD provide site support for identified functions and Drawing Management including the polylining of floor plans.

Responsibilities:

Communicate and/or interface with JLL and client's leadership at sites around the world (North America, Latin America, Asia Pacific and EMEA regions).

There could be some non-typical work hours involved (e.g., communication by phone with Asia Pacific region may have to occur outside of EST working hours)

Collect data in an efficient manner and accurately record it in the predefined collection templates.

Diligently follow up with the required contacts to ensure that the data is collected on time. Escalate any issues in a timely manner so that senior leadership can help clear roadblocks

Enter data into Manhattan CenterStone via system bulk uploads and/or by editing individual records or coordinate with other team members doing the same.

Manage drawings in and out of Client’s CenterStone IWMS platform thru check-out/in.

Convert new drawings to standardized format and simplified CAD layering configuration.

Maintain Master building floor plans and as-built furniture plans using CAD, often based off mark-up/redline.

Completes polylining for area measurements based on the BOMA Standard Method for Measuring Floor Area in Office Buildings.

Proactively meet established critical timelines and targets in a cost effective manner

Produce relevant Excel reports and distribute to all interested parties.

Periodically review database data, note and resolve anomalies through consultation with site contact, and input necessary corrections

Demonstrate proficiency in the use of all related technology systems, as required for assigned projects.

Qualifications:

Proficient computer and Advanced MS Office skills, including MS Word, Excel, and Outlook.

Ability to quickly learn and effectively utilize various facility management and database software tools

Experience in collecting and manipulating data in a corporate real estate environment is a plus as well as experience in IWMS tools and specifically Manhattan CenterStone.

Proficient skills in AutoCAD 2013 or more recent version.

Associates or technical certificate a plus but not required with three to five years relevant experience.

Demonstrated collaboration, organizational, and communications skills including fluency in both verbal and written English language skills. Secondary written and verbal language skills a plus.

Self-starter, able to work independently, and within virtual team environment in particular within webex teleconferences.

Easily able to manage multiple client and team interactions simultaneously, exhibiting strong customer service orientation

High level of attention to detail and able to interact comfortably with a full range of decision makers from direct supervisors to senior management.
