job_description:
Title: Sr. Manager – Fleet Strategy & Analytics

Summary:

The Sr. Manager of Fleet Strategy & Analytics will be responsible for developing and delivering critical business insights and decision support to the Fleet & Supply Chain leadership organizations. This includes end-to-end analysis of a vehicles lifecycle from procurement to disposal to best optimize holding costs, maximize revenue, and operate to strategic business priorities. This position will be located in our World Headquarters Parsippany, NJ office.

Responsibilities:
Lead team/individual efforts to develop accurate and timely analyses on a wide variety of areas related fleet operations/fleet management/supply chain/fleet procurement. This may include analysis of operating behaviors, total cost of ownership, vehicle lifecycle management, supply chain impacts, vehicle sales optimization, etc. Draws conclusions and makes recommendations based on analysis.
Partners with Leadership Teams at Headquarters as well as field teams providing consultancy services on analytics capabilities to solve business challenges through operational analytics, financial modeling, and business foresight.
Deliver point in time analytics supporting current business needs and anticipate volatility in key focus areas.
Partner with cross functional teams (Revenue, Field Operations, Car Sales, Supply Chain, etc.) to understand and represent implications of strategic changes to overall business and functional areas.
Oversee and manage team of 2 strategy & analytics analysts
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Analytics/Data Science or related field and previous experience in business analytics & financial modeling
Demonstrated financial and business acumen.
Ability to think strategically and identify critical success factors when developing analysis and reporting activities. Ability to translate diverse pieces of information into meaningful conclusions and results.
Proven experience in continuous improvement methodology and solid problem-solving skills to quickly assess an issue, determine root cause, identify possible solutions, make recommendations and drive implementation.
Demonstrated organizational, detail orientation, prioritization and time management skills to drive timely business results.
Demonstrated change management aptitude and ability. Takes a proactive role in bring about change, applying new ways to develop the business through improved management of people and processes.
Proven ability to build relationships at all levels to include remote partners and to influence executives, peers and team members.
Ability to work effectively in a team oriented, high demand and fast paced environment.
Strong communication (verbal and written) and facilitation skills to effectively deal with various levels of management and staff.
Demonstrated leadership skills to effectively develop and lead a high performing team to meet the function/department/company short-term goals and objectives.
Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality and work with highly sensitive data and information.
Required Skills:
Applied knowledge of data analysis and reporting
Demonstrated skill in accessing, compiling, and analyzing large volumes of data
Demonstrated skill in problem solving and recommending solutions based on analysis
Expert use of Microsoft Access, PowerPoint, Excel,
Expert use of database query languages (SAS/SQL)
Drug screening is a part of our hiring process.

The Manager, Digital Ad Operations will oversee, participate in and be the escalation point for the execution, management and optimization of digital marketing campaigns aimed at both branding and response objectives. Stay current and aware of changes and updates in ad server and help communicate to necessary teams

4+ years of experience using DoubleClick, Atlas, WebTrends, Omniture, Google Analytics, etc.

Excellent communications skills, both written and verbal

Comfortable working with vendors, clients, and other outside parties

Job Description:

About This Role

We need someone to provide technical leadership covering a range of data analysis functions. These include data modeling, structured query language (SQL), data quality, data profiling, extract-transform-load (ETL), metadata enrichment and management, data provenance and lineage, report design and other specialized data management functions. You're a solid, independent, senior lead equipped to manage and direct activities related to analysis, design and support of technical data management solutions for larger projects. This individual will develop database models and support documentation in order to meet business requirements for a large third normal form (3nf) data warehouse on an Oracle Exadata platform. Candidates must have working experience with Power Designer or ERWin, Entity-Relationship database design, Oracle/Exadata, Teradata Financial Services Logical Data Model (FSLDM), SQL scripts; performing logical and physical data modeling; implementing and testing database design. Qualified candidates must have experience with data model and data dictionary change management via an enterprise grade modeling tool.

Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. Here are the essential job functions of this position:
Elicit, analyze, interpret business and data requirements to develop complete business solutions, includes data models (entity relationship diagrams, dimensional data models), ETL and business rules, data management, governance, lineage, metadata and reporting elements.
Apply automation and innovation on new and on-going data platforms for those development projects aligned to business or organizational strategies.
Design, implement reporting platforms (e.g. modeling, ETL, BI framework) and complex ETL frameworks that meet business requirements. Work with technology/project teams to understand the business meaning of data, provide analysis and requirements so that data design is fully understood and the development initiatives are in line with intended design and standards.
Deliver business or enterprise data deliverables (that adhere to enterprise frameworks) for various platforms/servers/applications/systems.
Provide data analysis and requirements within enterprise platform (e.g. Hadoop).
Implement processes aligned to data management standards, ensure data quality and requirements are embedded in/adhered to within system development deliverables.
Develop, maintain knowledge of data available from upstream sources and data within various platforms.
Perform data profiling using TD tooling and ad hoc system query languages to validate data analysis.
Help development and testing teams resolve data issues.
.

Qualifications:

Preferred Qualifications - Here are the preferred qualifications for this role:
Experience with designing Oracle relational databases
Strong SQL skills
Oracle (hands on)
Experience designing logical/physical models for 3nf data warehouses
Working expertise in an enterprise grade data modeling tool preferably SAS Power Designer.

More information about this job: Short Description: The Manager, Insights and Analytics will be responsible for driving the design, development and ongoing enhancement of business insights and analytics across assigned business units within the Cooper Health System. This highly visible position will be part of the Enterprise Analytics team and the individual in this role will act as a champion and change agent for business analytics by driving the adoption of a culture of data-driven decision making within the assigned areas. The Manager will be someone who loves to bring data together to answer complex business questions that support the realization of operational and strategic goals. With minimal supervision, he /she will collaborate with the information technology, finance and ambulatory operations teams to synthesize and derive business insights and strategic guidance to the ambulatory and physician leadership teams. He /she will provide leadership for various analytical projects throughout their lifecycle, from conceptual and methodological design through to the presentation of findings and insights to business leaders. The successful candidate will be a self-motivated entrepreneurial individual who can easily function in a high demand and results-driven environment. He /she must have strong analytical and communication skills, and a passion for using data to drive decision-making at the operational and strategic levels. He /she will develop strong working relations with business partners to define and understand the drivers of business success. He /she will leverage on all available data sources to connect the dots and derive practical insights that facilitate strategic and operational decision-making. Special Requirements: Scheduled Days / Hours: M-F Advanced degree such as an MBA or Masters degree in relevant disciplines (e.g., Data Science, Engineering, Applied Sciences) 3+ years of professional experience in ambulatory or physician operations management 5+ years of professional experience in business analytics or other quantitative discipline in a data-centric business environment, preferably within the healthcare industry Strong client engagement skills with the ability to translate strategic and operational challenges into analytical projects and actions that are solution-driven Strong communication skills with an ability to translate complex analytical results into actionable recommendations through compelling and easy-to-digest reports and presentations Ability to handle multiple work assignment, manage multiple projects and priorities; and provide technical leadership in a an ambiguous and fast-paced environment Ability to effectively partner across all levels of the organization to provide thought leadership and guidance in the journey to create a data-driven leadership culture Demonstrated expertise in collecting and analyzing quantitative and qualitative data to generate fact-based recommendations and measurement of performance Working knowledge of various analytical and reporting tools (e.g., Tableau, Qlik, Domo)

Director, IT - Analytics

Human Resources – Workforce Analytics – Data Scientist (Associate)
JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.5 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at www.jpmorganchase.com.
Corporate Human Resources plays an integral role in designing, implementing, and managing global initiatives across the firm. The functional areas within Corporate HR include global Recruiting, Training, Talent and Development, Career Management, Diversity, Compensation, Benefits, Employee Relations, Technology, Finance, HR Service Delivery, and Workforce Analytics (WFA).
Workforce Analytics (WFA) is a newly established centralized global team. WFA is the application of quantitative methods, technology, and research to all of the people data and people decisions in the firm. We have a vision to help make individuals, teams, and businesses at JPMC among the most engaged and productive in the world. Our mission is to create workforce insights that help leaders make evidence-based people decisions that change behavior and drive measurable business outcomes.
Position Overview & Responsibilities:
WFA Advanced Analytics is responsible for leveraging large quantities of people-related data to assist HR executives, business partners, and employees make data-driven decisions. This position will focus largely on machine learning and natural language processing (NLP) applied to large amounts of open-text data from a variety of JPMC-wide sources, including Exit Interview surveys, Employee Opinion surveys, Culture & Conduct surveys, and other employee pulse polls. The Data Scientist will utilize experience exploring data, applying advanced statistical techniques, and designing machine learning algorithms to create innovative products that provide value to the company and its people. S/he will collaborate with HR Technology, Workforce Analytics Data Engineering, and other subject matter experts to build robust data pipelines, and will play a key role in improving the analytics infrastructure for WFA. The Data Scientist will report to the Head of WFA Advanced Analytics and join a highly agile cross-functional team that leads some of the most critical analytics projects in HR, including reporting and analytics deliverables for the firm-wide and HR Operating Committees.
Candidate Profile
The ideal candidate will demonstrate skill in client engagement, descriptive data analysis, and creative problem solving using programming languages like Python. S/He will possess significant knowledge and experience with natural language processing. S/He will have significant skill and experience in predictive model development & validation, as well as in communicating technical subject-matter to a variety of audiences.
Proven leadership and skills in data exploration, relationship management and data-driven story telling will be vital to success in this position. S/He must have proven successes in balancing long term visionary planning with the ability to create practical, actionable plans that are coherent and understood by stakeholders. Beyond strong programming and analytics skills, the ideal candidate will be innovative, self-motivated, and inclined to create genuine business value through the alignment of technology, data and business interests.
Key Responsibilities
Partner with HR, business, and functional groups to provide insightful analytics with actionable paths forward
Gather, manipulate, and explore large datasets to test hypotheses and extract useful insights
Reporting, data narratives, and analytics deliverables for the HR Operating Committee and others
Build innovative models, tools and applications that apply NLP and machine learning algorithms at scale
Partner with clients to promote evidence-based decision-making and devise action plans that nudge behavior changes
Requirements
B.S. in a quantitative field required; M.S. or Ph.D. preferred
2 years of professional experience in a related field desired
Significant SQL and Python programming experience
Experience with Natural Language Processing and Apache Spark preferred
Familiarity with Tableau desired
Strong communication skills and a team-oriented attitude

The National Director is a senior level healthcare data scientist who provides leadership of the data reporting and analytics team across multiple locations, enabling the transformation of healthcare data into actionable information to inform the clinical and business decisions of SHM's clients. The Director will oversee reporting solutions, technology and vendor relationships to optimize outcomes and increase value for SHM clients. S/he will function as a subject matter expert on organizational data stores, data access, healthcare data science, claims analytics, statistical analyses, reporting processes and data visualization. Essential Job functions: Provides expert consultation on the best fit technology and representation of data to meet the stakeholder objectives Collaborates with content experts to ensure clear documentation of clinical and business data reporting and analytics requirements, including user acceptance testing to ensure that deliverables meet expectations Develops and optimizes methodology to gather business requirements regarding integrating data from disparate sources including but not limited to EHRs, payers/insurers, hospitals, registries and data aggregators. Leads the team to develop reports, dashboards, and analytics packages using the full range of functionality available through business intelligence suite of tools Builds data models and analyzes their content to discover trends, test hypotheses, and improve outcomes Analyzes data and reports to identify ways to increase healthcare quality, reduce costs, and improve profitability Works with team members to develop solutions that are high performance and as close to real-time as possible. Ensures adaptive management of a team through the effective deployment of resources and streamlined processes, ensuring productivity targets, validity and quality of the data gathered in support of the evolving data reporting and trending requirements Leads and mentors the analytics and report writing team whose responsibilities are to: Use database queries, spreadsheets, charts, graphs, and other analytics techniques to discover, explore, document and present issues and trends from the organization's data store. Develop and maintain ad-hoc and scheduled operational reports that assist management in effecting organizational change and incent better organizational outcomes. Lead/participate in analytical investigations aimed at addressing specific business and/or clinical situations using data with an emphasis on identifying and interpreting trends. Develop and make presentations that highlight the exploratory discoveries using a combination of visual and verbal techniques. Resolve key data issues involving the quality and consistency of data for analytical purposes. Develop and maintain procedures that pre-process and pre-summarize data to organize data for faster, easier, and repeatable use within reports. Collaborate with the database and data loading development team on an as-needed basis to influence the structure of data storage and retrieval mechanisms to better support the reporting needs. General Job functions: Provides robust reports/analytics used to detect trends, practice deviations, and any risks to data quality Continually looks for opportunities to streamline and automate operations Collaborates with the database and data loading development team to build and maintain database solutions that optimize outcomes and increase perceived value of the SMG "enterprise" Resolves key data issues involving quality, consistency of data for analytical purposes Provides ad-hoc data support on complex subjects and materials in an expedited manner Leads analytical investigations aimed at answering specific "business" problems using data with an emphasis on identifying and interpreting trends Enables actionable follow up with external business partners to re-mediate observed issues when appropriate Locates and collaborates with the data loading development team to extract data from a variety of sources for use in reporting, analysis and statistical models Ability to independently: Gather requirements from non-technical business & clinical workforce members Synthesize requirements into a comprehensive specification for development by technical resources Leadership, Mentorship, and Project Management: Lead large projects associated with ongoing development of data and data services; lead the development of a data governance process for SHM clients Responsible for managing new projects independently Participate as a key team member in organizational SHM projects Function as a consultant on organization projects with domain knowledge around data, data sources, the data platform and analytics Provide mentorship to other members of the data analytics and IT teams through coaching, mentoring, and acting as a positive role model and subject matter expert on data, data platforms and analytics Act as a consultant and subject matter expert within the organization and at meetings related to data analytics and data science Process Improvement Actively identify opportunities for improvement within the functional area of data analytics and data management and suggest modifications. Identify process that requires improvement, present improvement plan, revise plan based on feedback and manage implementation of change. Identify opportunities, deficiency or gaps in data models within the organization Take ownership of identified gaps, propose, revise and execute changes to process Active member in creating, managing and maintaining the data governance process. Key subject matter expert in conjunction with leadership, consultants and business strategy in developing sustainable data architecture. Travel: Occasional travel between SMG locations/main campus and satellites may be required for meeting purposes. Valid driver's license required. Occasional travel to other SHM client practices within U.S. may be required

Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. The Manager, Insights and Analytics will be responsible for driving the design, development and ongoing enhancement of business insights and analytics across assigned business units within the Cooper Health System. This highly visible position will be part of the Enterprise Analytics team and the individual in this role will act as a champion and change agent for business analytics by driving the adoption of a culture of data-driven decision making within the assigned areas.

The Manager will be someone who loves to bring data together to answer complex business questions that support the realization of operational and strategic goals. With minimal supervision, he /she will collaborate with the information technology, finance and ambulatory operations teams to synthesize and derive business insights and strategic guidance to the ambulatory and physician leadership teams. He /she will provide leadership for various analytical projects throughout their lifecycle, from conceptual and methodological design through to the presentation of findings and insights to business leaders.

The successful candidate will be a self-motivated entrepreneurial individual who can easily function in a high demand and results-driven environment. He /she must have strong analytical and communication skills, and a passion for using data to drive decision-making at the operational and strategic levels. He /she will develop strong working relations with business partners to define and understand the drivers of business success. He /she will leverage on all available data sources to “connect the dots” and derive practical insights that facilitate strategic and operational decision-making.

The Associate Director, Business Intelligence and Analytics will drive the business intelligence and reporting strategy for Patient and Specialty Services (PSS), fostering a data driven culture and enabling the organization to hard-wire analytics into decision making.

She/he will have oversight for reporting, analytics, data exploration and data preparation. This includes leading cross functional data management and analytics teams to conceptualize, build, deliver and roll-out of report-ing/analytics solutions.
She/he will partner directly with each of the Franchise Analytics Directors, to gather requirements for reporting and analytics. This individual will also be responsible for supporting these internal customers with reliable rele-vant reporting and insights to make informed decisions.

She/he will develop standardized support model/processes including development standards and documents across brands that helps the team to simplify process of maintaining automated reports, in addition to scaling solution to include new brands.

Single Point of Contact across PSS Analytics to all stakeholders ensuring release of high quality data

Drive reporting and performance of patient service field roles (Field reimbursement team and virtual nurse team).

A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at http://www.jpmorganchase.com/.


The Corporate Third Party Oversight (CTPO) team is responsible for developing, deploying, overseeing and on-going reporting of a program that drives the effective use of third parties to accomplish JPMorgan Chase's strategic goals. This includes building awareness of the program at the firm and ensuring consistency globally across both the Lines of Business (LOBs) and corporate groups. It also includes understanding and dissemination of regulatory requirements and reporting to regulators on the program and status. The major focus of the program is to ensure our vendors are performing to the same high standards that JPMorgan Chase holds itself accountable to including client service, quality, control, regulatory compliance, business resiliency and protection of information.

This role resides within The TPO Strategy and Operations Team, which is a centralized function that leads program and business management strategy for the larger CTPO Team. The team manages program planning and execution, communications and training, financial budgeting and forecasting, and The CTPO Book of Work. In addition, the team manages a centralized change management process, and supports program compliance reviews, as well as a supplier sanctions screening process.

The business writer-information designer will be responsible for the design and creation of executive level presentations for senior management. Creating engaging content and utilizing innovative tools will provide for polished storytelling to be used both inside and outside the firm. This role will interact with various levels of senior management, as well as operational and technical experts to visualize and produce new concepts in a clear, concise manner. A working knowledge of supplier management principles will provide for a solid foundation in being able to craft meaningful content for a variety of audiences. The audience could vary from presentations to the operating committee, and other internal key stakeholders, to government agencies who oversee/regulate supplier management/third party oversight activities for financial institutions.

Successful candidates will possess excellent interpersonal skills and demonstrated communication skills with respect to business writing, proofreading, and editing of content from within the larger team. A knack for understanding and visualizing new concepts is key in ensuring content is delivered in a professional manner. This role requires an in-depth working knowledge of PowerPoint, and other leading edge presentation tools.

Qualifications

Business Writer / Information Designer with 7 years of experience, preferably in management consulting, news industry or the financial services industry

Able to capture complex ideas and present in clear, concise and engaging manner

Business acumen in understanding and tailoring written communications for senior management

Demonstrated ability with written communications; including impeccable grammar, content editing and proofreading

Proficiency in understanding and visualizing new concepts

Talent and passion for visualizing information and storytelling

PowerPoint expert

Short-selected candidates will be expected to provide examples of work to the hiring manager during the interview process

job_description:
Overview

Princeton University’s Plasma Physics Laboratory (PPPL) is in the process of growing a High Performance Computing group which will play a leading role in further strengthening and enhancing PPPL's world-leading research program in fusion and plasma science. The advent of the DOE Exascale Computing Project (ECP) and PPPL's leading role in it provides a great opportunity to develop simulation codes that will exlpoit fully the power of petascale and exascale computing platforms, and even those that lie beyond. This group currently has multiple research positions available in computational science, aimed at advancing the physics understanding of fusion and plasma science.

Responsibilities

Opportunities exist for highly qualified applied mathematicians, computer scientists, and computational physicists with interest in advanced simulation. Experience in the development of new mathematical algorithms, enhancing application performance in modern computing platforms, and/or software infrastructure to support large-scale data management and data science is desirable. Experience in computational plasma physics or fluid dynamics is desirable but not necessary. The successful candidate would be expected to take a leading role on computational aspects of whole device modeling of fusion plasmas, which is part of the ECP, and other synergistic computational projects under the auspices of the Scientific Discovery with Advanced Computing (SciDAC) program.

Qualifications

Experience in computational plasma physics or fluid dynamics is desirable but not necessary.

(S)he will normally be expected to have at least two years of postdoctoral experience. These projects are strongly collaborative and require teamwork with applied mathematicians, computer scientists, and plasma physicist within PPPL as well as other national laboratories and Universities.

Job Description

Ecosystem Visualization Designer

The Future of Business group is a small, high-performance team whose mission is to support our internal partners, enhance the TCS brand image and develop/nurture business-side, executive level relationships with clients and other stakeholders through thought leadership and storytelling. Our thought leadership centers on the convergence and combinatorial effects of science, technology and societal factors that are shaping our rapidly emerging future, and the implications for business, institutions and society at large.

Our team is looking for an Ecosystem Visualization Designer who can create compelling and engaging graphics and visualizations for our executive level audience. This position will be an integral member of the team, working closely with us to contribute to and advance our thought leadership. You’ll get to spend your time creating visual representations of business ecosystems, as well as other depictions of the future, and enhance our storytelling of how new advancements in science and technology will affect businesses and society in the next 10 to 20 years and beyond. We’re looking for someone who can look into the future, while at the same time be a “doer” who can get things done with a small team and limited resources.

Responsibilities
Transform abstract information into attractive and easy to understand visuals across multiple mediums that tell compelling stories to non-technical audiences
Create and refine visualizations, including futuristic societal ecosystem models, future scenarios, and other thought leadership assets
Work with multiple stakeholders; and abstract, complex and futuristic concepts to create visuals and imagery including icons, graphical depictions, templates, whiteboard animations and videos
Stay abreast of industry leading technologies and trends, to identify opportunities to improve digital storytelling

Requirements
Proven graphic design experience for B2B companies
Strong expertise with Illustrator and PowerPoint
Strong collaboration; verbal and visual communication skills. Attention to detail
• Experience with the following tools are a plus:
o Photoshop

o Whiteboard animation tools such as VideoScribe, RawShorts, etc.

o Audio post-production editing experience with tools such as GarageBand, LogicPro X, Cakewalk Sonar, Audacity, etc.

o Video post-production editing experience with tools such as Adobe Premiere Pro CC, Final Cut Pro X, etc.

Summer Interns will work on an exciting mix of strategically-aligned challenging assignments and projects that help drive the achievement of the organization's strategy and mission. Job Description

BD (Becton, Dickinson and Company), a leading global medical technology company, is seeking high-potential technical talent for its Technology Leadership Development Program (TLDP). The TLDP's vision is to develop future leaders of BD's R&D organization, by providing TLDP associates with broad and deep technical assignments across BD.

Program Overview

The program consists of three progressively more challenging assignments (18 months each) which span multiple businesses and geographic locations within the company, strengthening the technical depth and skills of these high-potential associates while developing their leadership skills and stretching them across multiple disciplines. A personalized and dynamic career path is sculpted for each individual TLDP, based on personal skills and interests, with the influence of senior R&D leaders. Assignments will focus on developing each participant's domain expertise, leadership abilities, and cross-functional skills, and business acumen.

Examples of first assignments include design and development of product components in drug delivery systems or high tech diagnostics devices, contributing to the development of a novel materials technology that enables invention of new medical devices and therapies, participating in the development of new technologies that enable better and faster disease diagnostics, or leading a novel concept. Second assignments are more complex technically and typically include providing supervision and work direction for a small team. In the third assignment leadership is further developed by increased team sizes while the technical complexity and impact of the roles are also increased.

Qualifications:
Outstanding Ph.D. (exceptional research-based M.S. graduates will be considered) graduates with significant leadership experience and technical depth in engineering or life sciences fields, such as mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, biomedical engineering, chemical engineering, materials science, chemistry, biochemistry, cell biology, computer science, data science and related fields
Early Stage Career (less than 3 years of work experience beyond graduate degree)
Willingness and ability to relocate to different geographic locations for at least two out of the three assignments
In order to qualify for this position, you must be legally authorized to work in the United States without restriction as to duration.

Additional Locations

Description:

Verisk has an amazing story to tell…Named to Forbes America’s Best Mid-Size Employers 2017 List and Forbes World’s Most Innovative Companies 2017 Acknowledgment as a ‘best employer’ is a testament to the Verisk team around the world. At Verisk, you can build a rewarding career with challenging and meaningful work, create a positive, lasting impact on the business, and find the support, coaching, and training it takes to advance your career. Our commitment to individual choice lets you customize aspects of your career path, your educational opportunities and your benefits. And our culture of innovation means your ideas on how to improve our business will be heard. As key contributors to our success, our team members enjoy working in a business casual, collaborative environment that offers state-of-the-art resources, advanced technologies and an excellent benefits package!

If you’re looking for a career that transforms, inspires, challenges, and rewards you, then come join us!

Verisk Analytics is a global supplier of risk assessment services and decision analytics for customers in a variety of markets, including insurance, healthcare, financial services, supply chain, and others. At Verisk, you’ll be part of an organization that’s committed to serving the long-term interests of our stakeholders, including the communities where we operate.

The ISO unit of Verisk is looking for an Analyst to Senior Actuarial Analyst. ISO is comprised of multiple divisions that utilize actuarial talent. Several of these divisions are detailed below.

The Analytical Data Management (ADM) division is ISO's data refinery, ensuring that ISO's analytical engines are properly fueled. As an analyst in ADM you will help our customers provide quality data, so ISO can provide them quality products. You will apply actuarial, data science and analytical skills, as well as big data technology, with the purpose of building innovative, automated processes for enhancing data quality. You will seek to improve your understanding of property casualty insurance through work experience, CAS, CPCU, and/or IDMA studies. You will strive to help our team operate efficiently through centralization and standardization of processes, and you will work proactively to address our customers' questions and concerns about data quality.

The Actuarial Operations (AO) division is responsible for providing actuarial services for all lines of business, and you will be involved in a variety of production and special projects. Depending on your experience, you will be expected to possess or develop a broad set of skills to allow you to participate on several teams and projects, and the ability to handle different types of projects. Also, you will be requested to look for efficiencies and enhancements to actuarial and business processes.

The Data Products (DP) division is responsible for producing and enhancing property and casualty insurance based data products for one or more lines of business. You will also capitalize on the power of ISO databases to develop reports in response to customized data requests. In this role, you will utilize your technical/computer skills to support new product initiatives involving data and analysis to fulfill insurer information needs. In fulfilling your responsibilities, you will work with cutting-edge technology, i.e., Greenplum Computing Servers, SQL, and data visualization software. You will be tasked with reviewing data for reasonableness and assist in the preparation of promotional materials related to new data products developed by the Data Products division. You must be able to perform other duties as assigned. You need to collaborate well with others, have excellent communication skills and be comfortable providing feedback. We want someone with creativity, high energy and high standards.

The Regulatory & Contractual Reporting Division (RCR) is responsible for preparing data reviews, regulatory filings and compilations in a timely and accurate manner for submission to state insurance departments and ISO affiliates. Do you like working with data? Does the idea of working with intelligent, team oriented individuals excite you? Our analysts deal with data; data management and data analysis. You will have the opportunity to utilize your skills in Excel and use complicated, yet useful tools like SQL and VBA. We expect your communication skills are a part of the balance you bring to the table because responding to questions from customers (internal and external) and regulators on filings, circulars and other ISO products may be a part of your day to day job. However, it’s not just about what we do. It’s about what you do that can help us be a better company. We will look to you to do research and provide your findings into how we can improve our processes and procedures.

Title: Analyst to Senior Actuarial Analyst

Organizational Unit: ISO

Supervisory Responsibility: No

Responsibilities
Prepare products for regulators and internal & external customers in a timely and accurate manner. Products may include loss cost reviews, filings, circulars, annual statistical filings, and customized data products to meet customer needs.
Work on other projects such as class plan reviews, territorial reviews, regulatory reports and fulfilling contractual obligations.
Writing and running computer programs to extract data for review and report compilation.
Review the quality of data submitted by insurance companies both on transactional and aggregate levels.
Develop more efficient, automated ways to improve processing including data quality and error detection processes. This can include providing suggestions for improvements in ratemaking and data quality review procedures.
Help respond to questions from regulators and insurers on filings, circulars and other products.
Contact ISO’s insurer customers and other organizations regarding the reasonableness of reported data.
Make actuarial and data management presentations to Insurer Panels, insurers who report data to us and ISO users of data.
Collaborate with other ISO divisions (actuarial, analytical and technology) on improving data, products and procedures.
Become a subject matter expert on one or more lines of property-casualty insurance business
Perform other duties as assigned.
Requirements
Graduate or Bachelor's degree with a major in Mathematics, Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Risk Management, Operational Research or related discipline.
1-3 years of Property-Casualty insurance work experience preferred.
Passing of at least one actuarial exam is preferred.
Data management skills or knowledge of insurance data management principles is a plus.
Experience in quantitative and qualitative data analysis.
Some familiarity with insurance coverages, actuarial methodologies and quality control.
Technical background should include a working knowledge of MS Office applications and understanding of computer programming concepts.
Knowledge of SQL, SAS, R, ETL tools or Business Rules Engines is a plus
Background experience in Tableau, Spotfire, COGNOS, or other data visualization software would be advantageous.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Ability to work under time constraints, multi-task, and adjust plans in the face of changing priorities.
Continued desire and ability to learn.
Ability to perform essential job duties with or without reasonable accommodation.
You will be part of a culture that celebrates success, recognizes and rewards achievements and excellence, encourages experimentation and learning from failure, and provides personal and professional enrichment opportunities.

If this opportunity looks exciting and challenging to you, please submit your application by hitting “Submit Now”.

We offer a competitive salary, benefits package which includes full health care options, a 401(k) plan, and generous Paid-Time-Off.

Visit our website at www.verisk.com to learn more about our company. All members of the Verisk Analytics Family of Companies are equal opportunity employers.

Description

Celgene is a global biopharmaceutical company leading the way in medical innovation to help patients live longer, better lives. Our purpose as a company is to discover and develop therapies that will change the course of human health. We value our passion for patients, quest for innovation, spirit of independence and love of challenge. With a presence in more than 70 countries, and growing - we look for talented people to grow our business, advance our science and contribute to our unique culture.

We seek a talented, collaborative inter-disciplinary scientist to lead work on the computational analysis of high-dimensional tissue, cell and molecular profiling data. This individual will play a key scientific role leveraging innovative computational analysis strategies and rich patient data to empower data-driven decisions for therapeutic programs in Celgene’s Immunology & Inflammation (I&I) Thematic Center of Excellence (TCoE).

Applications range from providing deep insight into therapeutic mechanisms of action for existing and novel therapies as they transition into clinic, identification and predictive leverage of patient phenotypes associated with therapeutic effect and outcome in key indications, and downstream development of molecular biomarker hypotheses into clinical diagnostics. Analysis scenarios will involve exploratory clinical data and output from transcriptomic, proteomic, genomic, and a wide range of innovative cell-molecular profiling platforms.

The position would suit an individual with strong scientific leadership potential and excellent communication and collaboration skills. Applications are encouraged from those involved in innovative translational biomarker research for complex indications in clinical or industrial research environments. The role offers the opportunity to impact directly the delivery of truly transformational and life-changing therapies in key diseases of unmet medical need.

Strong interest in the inter-disciplinary application of computational analysis methods to life sciences data is imperative. Areas of particular focus include: elucidation of pharmacogenomics and pharmacodynamics hypotheses derived from trial data; methods to highlight clear mechanistic differentiation of Celgene assets comparing to existing therapeutics in key indications; and predictive patient stratification to identify biomarker-defined subgroups of unmet medical need and/or enriched therapeutic response via machine learning analysis of molecular profiling data.

Responsibilities
Working in collaboration with computational, biological and clinical scientists across the Celgene Research and Early Development organization, responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Pursuit and supervision of leading computational biology research towards key Celgene scientific objectives, including potential for line management of junior staff.
Active participation as a core team member in the RIKU Research Analytics group and focused collaboration with translational researchers in our I&I TCoE.
Coordinated application of novel computational analysis and biological interpretation approaches to leverage internal, public and partner datasets and empower data-driven decisions across therapeutic programs.
Multi-disciplinary collaboration to investigate compound and disease properties, influence decision making across the translational research and clinical development process, and feedback to inform early development of novel therapies.
Guide development of molecular patient selection and biomarker hypotheses towards clinical diagnostics.
Participation in and oversight of scientific report writing. Presentation of methods, results and conclusions to a publishable standard.
Contribution to planning and execution of collaborative projects with leading academic and commercial research groups worldwide.
Background experience & complementary knowledge
A Ph.D. in computational biology, bioinformatics, or related field from a recognized higher-education establishment.
8+ years post-doctoral experience of inter-disciplinary computational and molecular biomarker research in university, hospital or biotechnology environments.
3+ years experience in pharma/biotech research environment preferable.
Strong knowledge required of predictive analytical practice and molecular diagnostic development. Working knowledge of clinical statistics desirable.
Previous experience of research supervision and track record of peer-reviewed publication in relevant scientific journals.
Expertise in algorithmic implementation, statistical programming and data manipulation, using e.g. R/Bioconductor, Matlab, Python, and contemporary, open-source bioinformatics tools and database structures.
Proven problem-solving skills, collaborative nature and adaptability across disciplines.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Fluent verbal and written English language skills prerequisite.

About our Global Clinical Development (GCD) Team:
OPDC-GCD are a group of physicians and scientists who lead clinical development activities for Otsuka’s global health-care products. Our team is collaborative, innovative with a mantra of “acting as though the company was our own.”
Our responsibilities range from due-diligence evaluations, where we stress-test others’ development plans, to development and implementation of our own global development & commercialization plans (GDCP). The GDCP translates basic research and preclinical pharmacology & toxicology into a streamlined plan for first in man, proof of mechanism, registrational and post-approval trials. Its goal is to efficiently evaluate the product’s potential and probability of success, support an effective commercial launch and plan for meaningful innovations to improve or expand the value of the initial product for our global customers (patients, prescribers and payors).
Otsuka is seeking an Associate Director/Director, Global Clinical Development for our Rockville, MD or Princeton, NJ offices, who will be responsible for the design and oversight of clinical research programs and protocols for OPDC products under good clinical practice (GCP). The incumbent will be responsible for the evaluation and clinical development of CNS compounds at different stages of development for a global healthcare market.
Responsibilities
Consults with patients (or their representatives), clinical, regulatory and scientific leaders, while thoughtfully applying their recommendations toward optimizing trial objectives, designs and protocols.
Develops focused expertise to serve as an internal medical/scientific consultant to health economic, medical affairs, marketing, regulatory, statistical and other research project team members, as well as to external regulatory agencies.
Authors program strategies (i.e., GDCP) and oversees trials essential for determining the clinical safety, efficacy, medical usefulness, and value of the drug or medical device product candidates.
Interprets and communicates results of Phase I-IV investigations in preparation for a new drug.
Acts as the signatory on NDA submissions and clinical study and safety documents.
Involved in product life cycle management from the earliest stages of development, constantly seeking innovations to add value strategically.
Provides strategic oversight in our vendor and CRO relationships and provides clinical input into their governance committees.
Will help lead and support regulatory filing activities and documents. Provides strategic direction and editing to provide concise, clear and convincing argumentation in all such written and verbal communications.

Qualifications
D., D.O., or M.D./Ph.D., preferably a psychiatrist or neurologist, with at least 3-6 years of experience in the pharmaceutical industry including prior management experience (direct or indirect). Three years applies to Associate Director level; 6 years applies to Director level.
A thorough knowledge of clinical medicine and science management. This entails defining critical objectives clearly and maintaining focus toward achieving business outcomes on time, on budget and with superior quality.
An ability to communicate effectively in meetings and via written and oral presentations is essential. This includes facility with the Microsoft suite of programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook).
Demonstrated experience leading, managing and motivating team members (e.g., internal staff and external investigators or consultants). While not essential, prior personnel management experience, will support position at entry (Associate Director/Director).
An advanced understanding of drug development principles and clinical trial implementation, management and reporting are essential and will be further developed, including:
Flexibility in working across different therapeutic areas and experience in different stages of clinical development.
Working knowledge of associated disciplines, including biostatistics, clinical pharmacology, formulation science, data management, and medical writing.
Complete understanding of the global regulatory requirements. Demonstrated experience in successful regulatory filings, while not essential, is an advantage.
Working knowledge of the principles of health value creation, including financial assessment (e.g., net present value), project planning and budgeting, market research and commercialization strategies.
Dedication to assigned, developed projects and project goals. This includes an appreciation of the principles applied in setting and achieving corporate goals through matrixed teamwork in a compliant, regulated business setting.
Willingness to travel 30% of time, over weekends and ability to travel internationally.

OTSUKA PHARMACEUTICAL DEVELOPMENT & COMMERCIALIZATION, INC. (OPDC)
Otsuka Pharmaceutical Company is a global healthcare company with the corporate philosophy: “Otsuka-people creating new products for better health worldwide.” Otsuka researches, develops, manufactures and markets innovative products, with a focus on pharmaceutical products to meet unmet medical needs as well as nutraceutical products for the maintenance of everyday health.

In pharmaceuticals, Otsuka is a leader in the challenging area of mental health and has research programs on several under-addressed diseases including tuberculosis, a significant global public health issue. These commitments illustrate how Otsuka is a “big venture” company at heart, applying a youthful spirit of creativity in everything it does.

Otsuka Pharmaceutical Company is a subsidiary of Otsuka Holdings Co., Ltd. headquartered in Tokyo, Japan. The Otsuka group of companies employed 45,000 people worldwide and had consolidated sales of approximately USD 11 billion (9.9 billion) in 2016.

All Otsuka stories start by taking the road less travelled. Learn more about Otsuka Pharmaceutical Company on its global website at www.otsuka.co.jp/en. Learn more about Otsuka in the U.S. at www.otsuka-us.com.

QVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Job Description

Job Description
The Franchise PSS Analytics, Data, and Effectiveness lead will set the strategic direction for an insights-driven analytics and research team that proactively helps drive performance and shape the future of Novartis Franchise and our Patient and Specialty Services organization.

In partnership with Franchise Heads, Patient Access Team and PSS Leadership, and working directly for the Executive Director for PSS Analytics, Data, and Effectiveness, this individual will take a leading role in shaping strategy and operational management of data management (internal and external) and analytics to support effective data review and end-to-end patient journey tracking and visualization across the Novartis Franchise Pharma portfolio. Through this strategic understanding and thought leadership, this individual will define the key business questions and challenges facing our business that are critical to achieving business objectives. Translation of these questions/challenges into actionable insights and analytics initiatives is essential enable the development of recommendations and solutions so that franchise business and brand strategies can be developed to meet performance expectations. Coordinates process improvement initiatives within and across franchise PSS, establishing and tracking end-to-end patient journey performance metrics for all supported franchise programs. Many of the PSS programs are executed via external parties and we have a variety of data feeds/sources/inputs, the role of this person is to collectively work with our PSS program leads and the franchise commercial leadership to track performance, analyze effectiveness, model impact of changes, and drive the reporting and analytical agenda for the group.

This individual will be an Analytics/Data/Effectiveness expert for PSS, providing problem solving leadership to enable analytic-based solutions to business questions and challenges. This individual is recognized as an expert within the organization analytics/tracking/effectiveness of many of the US Pharma HUB Operations and tracking, Data Management Strategy, Dashboards (Brand/Franchise/Field), Program/Performance tracking/effectiveness and reporting across all programs (co-pay, adherence, hub operations, scenario planning etc..) She/he is able to provide problem solving leadership to enable analytic-based solutions to business questions and challenges in situations requiring new/innovative approaches. This person will guide a team of Analytics associates who work with US franchise brand teams/other analysts to address business questions to help shape channel/customer contracts, design and refine patient service programs, shape our interactions with specialty pharmacies, build strategies, and maximize patient impact and financial return for our program spend. The team will be generating, analyzing and synthesizing data & insights for our brands and customers/channels is critical to the development of brand and customer strategies and to driving business performance.

Single Point of Contact across PSS Analytics to all stakeholders ensuring release of high quality data:
Understands business priorities/challenges and translates into data performance metrics and advanced predictive analytics for franchise product support
Ensure high quality, full visibility and insights into end-to-end patient journey for supported Novartis Franchise Pharma brands
Manage communications to key stakeholders inside the organization as it relates to Franchise PSS data
Regularly interacts with external and internal vendors to ensure high standard of PSS data and performance tracking - timely, accurate & complete
Rapidly problem solves and resolves data and performance issues for Franchise PSS Analytics as needed, working closely with IT, DS & E, Analytics, Sales & Marketing, Finance, Managed Markets, Market Access operations teams
Defines key brand, hub, and SP metrics and utilizes reports and dashboards to monitor quality and enforce SLAs and agreements
Interface with all relevant stakeholders to define and shape brand and Patient Service strategy and analytics to support and shape decision making
Manage vendors and off-shore team to ensure execution of all analyses and reports
Drive reporting and performance of patient service field roles (where applicable)
Ensures smooth maintenance of external data (syndicated and SP), solving the day to day issues
Collaborate with peer PSS Analytics staff to ensure consistent understanding and communication of common source issues (SP, HUB, 3rd Party Data)
Minimum requirements
Education: Bachelor's Degree in relevant area required, MBA Preferred

Languages: English

Experience:
MUST HAVES:
3-5 years Specialty pharmaceutical industry or related field
Strong understanding of data warehouse and master data architecture and processes
Strong communication skills and ability to translate technical information into business relevant information
Strong business knowledge and mindset to provide guidance on how data can be applied to answer business questions o Understanding of how data is used for analytics & reporting
Vendor management skills to enforce SLAs based on data quality performance
Strong problem solving & project management skills
PREFERRED:
Deep understanding of specialty brand data (i.e. data from HUB services, Specialty Pharmacies, Syndicated vendors, internal data etc.)
Prior experience in Business roles, both Sales & Marketing highly desirable
Ability to interface with and influence senior business leaders

Overview
Princeton University’s Plasma Physics Laboratory (PPPL) is in the process of growing a High Performance Computing group which will play a leading role in further strengthening and enhancing PPPL's world-leading research program in fusion and plasma science. The advent of the DOE Exascale Computing Project (ECP) and PPPL's leading role in it provides a great opportunity to develop simulation codes that will exlpoit fully the power of petascale and exascale computing platforms, and even those that lie beyond. This group currently has multiple entry level research positions available in computational science, aimed at advancing the physics understanding of fusion and plasma science.
Please submit resume and three letters of recommendation.
Responsibilities
The successful candidate would be expected to participate on whole device modeling of fusion plasmas, which is part of the ECP, and other synergistic computational projects under the auspices of the Scientific Discovery with Advanced Computing (SciDAC) program. These projects are strongly collaborative and require teamwork with applied mathematicians, computer scientists, and plasma physicist within PPPL as well as other national laboratories and Universities.
Qualifications
Opportunities exist for highly qualified applied mathematicians, computer scientists, and computational physicists with interest in advanced simulation. Experience in the development of new mathematical algorithms, enhancing application performance in modern computing platforms, and/or software infrastructure to support large-scale data management and data science is desirable. Experience in computational plasma physics or fluid dynamics is desirable but not necessary.
Princeton University is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Overview
Princeton University’s Plasma Physics Laboratory (PPPL) is in the process of growing a High Performance Computing group which will play a leading role in further strengthening and enhancing PPPL's world-leading research program in fusion and plasma science. The advent of the DOE Exascale Computing Project (ECP) and PPPL's leading role in it provides a great opportunity to develop simulation codes that will exlpoit fully the power of petascale and exascale computing platforms, and even those that lie beyond. This group currently has multiple entry level research positions available in computational science, aimed at advancing the physics understanding of fusion and plasma science.
Please submit resume and three letters of recommendation.
Responsibilities
The successful candidate would be expected to participate on whole device modeling of fusion plasmas, which is part of the ECP, and other synergistic computational projects under the auspices of the Scientific Discovery with Advanced Computing (SciDAC) program. These projects are strongly collaborative and require teamwork with applied mathematicians, computer scientists, and plasma physicist within PPPL as well as other national laboratories and Universities.
Qualifications
Opportunities exist for highly qualified applied mathematicians, computer scientists, and computational physicists with interest in advanced simulation. Experience in the development of new mathematical algorithms, enhancing application performance in modern computing platforms, and/or software infrastructure to support large-scale data management and data science is desirable. Experience in computational plasma physics or fluid dynamics is desirable but not necessary.

job_description:
Overview
About our Global Clinical Development (GCD) Team:
OPDC-GCD are a group of physicians and scientists who lead clinical development activities for Otsuka’s global health-care products. Our team is collaborative, innovative with a mantra of “acting as though the company was our own.”
Our responsibilities range from due-diligence evaluations, where we stress-test others’ development plans, to development and implementation of our own global development & commercialization plans (GDCP). The GDCP translates basic research and preclinical pharmacology & toxicology into a streamlined plan for first in man, proof of mechanism, registrational and post-approval trials. Its goal is to efficiently evaluate the product’s potential and probability of success, support an effective commercial launch and plan for meaningful innovations to improve or expand the value of the initial product for our global customers (patients, prescribers and payors).
Otsuka is seeking an Associate Director/Director, Global Clinical Development for our Rockville, MD or Princeton, NJ offices, who will be responsible for the design and oversight of clinical research programs and protocols for OPDC products under good clinical practice (GCP). The incumbent will be responsible for the evaluation and clinical development of CNS compounds at different stages of development for a global healthcare market.
Responsibilities
Consults with patients (or their representatives), clinical, regulatory and scientific leaders, while thoughtfully applying their recommendations toward optimizing trial objectives, designs and protocols.
Develops focused expertise to serve as an internal medical/scientific consultant to health economic, medical affairs, marketing, regulatory, statistical and other research project team members, as well as to external regulatory agencies.
Authors program strategies (i.e., GDCP) and oversees trials essential for determining the clinical safety, efficacy, medical usefulness, and value of the drug or medical device product candidates.
Interprets and communicates results of Phase I-IV investigations in preparation for a new drug.
Acts as the signatory on NDA submissions and clinical study and safety documents.
Involved in product life cycle management from the earliest stages of development, constantly seeking innovations to add value strategically.
Provides strategic oversight in our vendor and CRO relationships and provides clinical input into their governance committees.
Will help lead and support regulatory filing activities and documents. Provides strategic direction and editing to provide concise, clear and convincing argumentation in all such written and verbal communications.

Qualifications
MD., D.O., or M.D./Ph.D., preferably a psychiatrist or neurologist, with at least 3-6 years of experience in the pharmaceutical industry including prior management experience (direct or indirect). Three years applies to Associate Director level; 6 years applies to Director level.
A thorough knowledge of clinical medicine and science management. This entails defining critical objectives clearly and maintaining focus toward achieving business outcomes on time, on budget and with superior quality.
An ability to communicate effectively in meetings and via written and oral presentations is essential. This includes facility with the Microsoft suite of programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook).
Demonstrated experience leading, managing and motivating team members (e.g., internal staff and external investigators or consultants). While not essential, prior personnel management experience, will support position at entry (Associate Director/Director).
An advanced understanding of drug development principles and clinical trial implementation, management and reporting are essential and will be further developed, including:
Flexibility in working across different therapeutic areas and experience in different stages of clinical development.
Working knowledge of associated disciplines, including biostatistics, clinical pharmacology, formulation science, data management, and medical writing.
Complete understanding of the global regulatory requirements. Demonstrated experience in successful regulatory filings, while not essential, is an advantage.
Working knowledge of the principles of health value creation, including financial assessment (e.g., net present value), project planning and budgeting, market research and commercialization strategies.
Dedication to assigned, developed projects and project goals. This includes an appreciation of the principles applied in setting and achieving corporate goals through matrixed teamwork in a compliant, regulated business setting.
Willingness to travel 30% of time, over weekends and ability to travel internationally.

Otsuka Pharmaceutical Company is a global healthcare company with the corporate philosophy: “Otsuka-people creating new products for better health worldwide.” Otsuka researches, develops, manufactures and markets innovative products, with a focus on pharmaceutical products to meet unmet medical needs as well as nutraceutical products for the maintenance of everyday health.

In pharmaceuticals, Otsuka is a leader in the challenging area of mental health and has research programs on several under-addressed diseases including tuberculosis, a significant global public health issue. These commitments illustrate how Otsuka is a “big venture” company at heart, applying a youthful spirit of creativity in everything it does.

Otsuka Pharmaceutical Company is a subsidiary of Otsuka Holdings Co., Ltd. headquartered in Tokyo, Japan. The Otsuka group of companies employed 45,000 people worldwide and had consolidated sales of approximately USD 11 billion (9.9 billion) in 2016.

All Otsuka stories start by taking the road less travelled. Learn more about Otsuka Pharmaceutical Company on its global website at www.otsuka.co.jp/en. Learn more about Otsuka in the U.S. at www.otsuka-us.com.

Disclaimer:
This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed by the people assigned to this position. It is not intended to include every job duty and responsibility specific to the position. Otsuka reserves the right to amend and change responsibilities to meet business and organizational needs as necessary.

Otsuka is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to their protected veteran or disabled status, or any protected status.

Knowledgent is a data intelligence company that enables enterprises to become digital and intelligent by innovating in and through data. We combine our data and analytics expertise with business specific domain knowledge. We are Informationists that are passionate about data.

Role Description
Rapidly develop data and analytic enablement solutions based on requests received by the IT Plan and respective Business Units in the Translational and Clinical Analytic domains.
Develop, optimize and test new/existing scientific analytics utilities/modules based in R, Python, Linux Shell Scripts, Matlab or other appropriate languages.
Develop, optimize and test new/existing R, Python and/or Matlab database utilities that will automate and streamline the reading and writing of data from/to the system database.
Develop, optimize and test new/existing visualization utilities via Spotfire, R/Shiny, Python and/or Matlab that interface directly with the respective data sources.
Develop, optimize and test new R and/or Python packages based on requests received.
Enable users to leverage Auto-Scaling High Performance Computing platforms based in the Research Cloud (Amazon Web Services) and contribute to the following, but not limited to:.
Data Workflow/Pipeline which includes pre and post processing of data/results.
Environment Optimization of various computational solvers (e.g. CVODE, etc…).
Where appropriate, develop, update and maintain system documentation such as user/admin guides, Installation Qualification/Operational Qualification (IQ/OQ) scripts, system/user acceptance test scripts, Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) / Work Instructions (WI), requirements specifications and traceability matrices.
Partner with other functional groups when required (e.g. Infrastructure, IT Plan, IT Build/Run End-Users, etc...) during the development, testing and implementation project phases to ensure systems are delivered according to the requirement specifications and expectations.
Required Functional/Technical Skills and Experience

A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or related field with extensive experience or Scientific Computing. Advanced degree preferred. A minimum of 7 to 10 years of information management and informatics work experience within Biotech or Pharmaceutical industry and proven track record of strong delivery.
Must be proficient in programming in R, Python, Matlab, SAS, SQL or similar programming language and has developed libraries and/or packages.
Must be proficient in optimizing computational solver environments in Linux based High Performance Computing platforms.
Experience in the following is a plus: Amazon Web Services, Oracle/MySQL/AWS RDS DB, Linux Shell Scripting, Linux OS, Sun Grid Engine (or similar high-end scheduler), StarCluster.
Demonstrated ability to understand complex scientific requirements to effectively communicate with users, understand their work, and translate requirements into software solutions.
Must possess the willingness to diversify skills and champion new innovations and solutions for the client.
Demonstrated success serving as a scientific programmer in one or more systems modeling projects in the related field.
Must be self-motivated and work independently with minimal supervision.
Experience in all aspects of the software development process, including requirements gathering, architecture, design, implementation, release, and maintenance.
Demonstrated success in delivering complex IT solutions following a Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
Must be a domain expert in the Translation Medicine and/or Clinical space within R&D.
Must be pragmatic about the tradeoffs between features, quality and timeliness.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.

Purpose
Conduct real world data studies to support the Novo Nordisk Inc. (NNI) evidence generation plan. Conduct analyses using internal and external real world data to generate unique disease insights and epidemiological information to improve patient care and support business needs. Drive innovation in Real World Data (RWD) analytics by implementing new analytic methods, platforms and technologies to answer research and business questions. Serve as subject matter expert on real world evidence and novel analytic methods.

Relationships
The manager reports directly to the Senior Director Real world data analytics. This is a US affiliate role focused on executing on US RWD strategy. As a key and visible RWD leader and champion in the US enterprise, he/she will conduct RWD studies; engage the clinical and commercial organization in increasing awareness of RWD, contributing to product evidence strategies, use of RWD and future investments in RWD.

Essential Functions
Conduct real world data studies to support the NNI evidence generation plan. These studies will be traditional outcomes research studies, economic evaluations of medicines and will be aimed will target top tier journals. Conduct analyses using internal and external real world data to generate unique disease insights and epidemiological information to improve patient care and support business needs. Drive innovation in RWD analytics by implementing new analytic methods, platforms and technologies to answer research and business questions. Find new ways to visualize and communicate data to drive a “data driven” organization. Serve as subject matter expert on real world evidence and novel analytic methods.

Physical Requirements
10% overnight travel required.

Development of People
This does not have direct reports.

Qualification
Doctoral degree (PhD, DrPH, ScD) in fields related to Health economics and outcomes research (HEOR) - outcomes research, health economics, epidemiology, biostatistics, data science, predictive analytics, health services research
Masters degree in fields related to HEOR - outcomes research, health economics, epidemiology, biostatistics, data science, predictive analytics, health services research with at least 2 years of work experience in real world data analytics
Pharmaceutical industry experience preferred
Experience working with longitudinal RWD assets (e.g., claims, electronic health records, and/or surveys)
Experience in the conduct of non-interventional research
Experience in using statistical software (e.g., R, Statistical Analysis System (SAS), Python, Statistical Package for the Social Sciences (SPSS), and/or Stata), database query (SQL) or visualization tools (e.g., Tableau) preferred
Peer-reviewed publication track record is a plus
Collaborative approach to problem-solving and ability to plan and multi-task
Excellent written and oral communication skills
