Title: Data Engineer- III

Location: Branchburg-NJ-USA

Duration: 5+ Months (Possibility of Extension)

Description:

The individual will be responsible for engineering of the Mobile Private Networks (MPN) routing and switching environment in support of the wholesale gateways to ensure both capacity needs and strategic features and functionality are met. This position includes responsibilities such as researching, identifying and engineering the site-specific configurations of the associated wholesale routing, switching and gateway environment at multiple locations. The individual must be detail oriented, think critically to solve issues in real-time and focused on the goals of adding capacity while maximizing customer uptime and minimizing impact.

MPN Transport Engineer
Overview
The individual will be responsible for engineering of the Mobile Private Networks (MPN)
routing and switching environment in support of the wholesale gateways to ensure both
capacity needs and strategic features and functionality are met. This position includes
responsibilities such as researching, identifying and engineering the site-specific configurations
of the associated wholesale routing, switching and gateway environment at multiple locations.
The individual must be detail oriented, think critically to solve issues in real-time and focused
on the goals of adding capacity while maximizing customer uptime and minimizing impact.
Responsibilities
· Engineer the routing and switching environment in a Mobile Switching Center (MSC) to
support the rollout of new virtual wholesale gateways.
· Produce timely and accurate configurations for MPN routers and switches which are in
line with established designs.
· Submit associated security, NMS, billing, etc. tickets and requests to other engineering
teams and follow up through ticket execution.
· Technically lead the project rollout by coordinating with internal and external teams to
set dates and drive changes into the network.
· Solid experience and proficiency in technical project leadership skills, the ability to build
productive relationships and the capability to lead cross functional team technical
discussions to a productive conclusion.
· Acts independently and as member of a highly technical team to advance the rollout of
the wholesale gateway capacity.
· Work with the performance and planning team to keep existing wholesale gateways
below engineering KPIs.
· Think critically and make technical and business decisions which drive progress forward
while putting customer uptime first.
· Develops resolutions to complex problems that require the frequent use of creativity.
· Focus on high availability, resiliency, security, efficiency, and operational supportability
while meeting or exceeding the project schedule.
· Exercises judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining results.
· Is accountable for the project results, summarizing the project status and
documentation. Familiar with the Agile process, Kanban boards and Jira.
Qualifications:
· 5+ years of experience with operating and engineering a Cisco routing and switching
environment.
o Cisco ASR1000/9000 routers, Cisco ASR5000/5500 gateways and Cisco Nexus
7000/9000.
· Detailed knowledge and direct operational experience with TCP/IP (v4 & v6), BGP, OSPF,
QOS, MPLS, AAA, and Diameter protocols.
· Experience in SDN, NFV, Openstack, Docker and Container deployments as well as the
FCAPS model to support service level orchestration.
· Experience with orchestration tools such as Itential Pronghorn, Cisco Network Services
Orchestrator (NSO) are a plus.
· Ability to learn new technologies quickly. Ability to perform independent analysis and
plan for implementation, paying special attention to details and objectives.
· Excellent communications, interpersonal, organizational, and problem solving skills.
· Meticulous attention to detail, with results-oriented focus.
· Wireless carrier experience or working knowledge of 3G & 4G telecommunications.
· Cisco certifications are a plus

Merck & Co., Inc. Kenilworth, N.J., U.S.A. known as Merck in the United States and Canada, is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. The difference between potential and achievement lies in the spark that fuels innovation and inventiveness; this is the space where Merck has codified its legacy for over a century. Merck?s success is backed by ethical integrity, forward momentum, and an inspiring mission to achieve new milestones in global healthcare.

Merck?s Global Human Health (GHH) Division abides by a ?patient first, profits later? ideology. Results-driven and ambitious, this team of individuals represents a functional balance between meeting company objectives and the needs of people around the world. The organization is comprised of sales and marketing professionals who are passionate about their role in bringing Merck's prescription medicines, vaccines, and other medical products to our customers worldwide.

Position Description:

In this exciting position the successful candidate will be responsible for bringing leading-edge marketing experience to support preparations for a Merck growth brand that positively impacts millions of lives globally.

Bringing a fresh perspective to the opportunity, you will assess the customer and patient landscape holistically, working with cross-functional partners and centers of excellence to ultimately deliver a compelling and best-in-industry brand experience.

You will be able to uncover, leverage and connect nuanced insights from the marketplace. Collaborating seamlessly with internal and external partners, your mission will be to connect data, technology and other solutions to solve customer and patient problems and take this brand from strength to strength.

Responsibilities:

+ Leverage new and emerging data and research sciences to uncover novel insights, while challenging and assessing current views and beliefs.

+ Consistently leverages digital and advanced analytics to enable the development and execution of patient and customer plans as part of the broader franchise strategies.

+ Embed test and learn approaches into strategy development.

+ Support projects as needed, including the development of customer and patient journeys that identify opportunities for engagement that create value for patients, customers and Merck/franchise.

Position Qualifications:

Education Minimum Requirement:

+ Bachelor Degree required.

+ Recent MBA preferred.

Required Experience and Skills:

+ Demonstrated ability to use data analytics to develop a theory, test a strategy and iteratively learn from the experience.

+ Experience working with various digital platforms to gain powerful insights into traditional and non-traditional customers.

+ Proven problem solving skills

+ Strong communications skills, with demonstrated ability to communication a plan or strategy effectively

+ 1-2 years of demonstrated teaming, collaboration skills

Preferred Experience and Skills:

+ Consumer marketing or Agency experience

+ Knowledge of customer journey / experience mapping and customer experience design

+ Self-motivated; hands-on approach to work

+ Bias towards speed and agility

Job Description
Join us on our exciting journey! IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Description

Business Transformation Senior Consultant

Foresight, an IQVIA company, is an organization where your career is in your own hands. We look for self-starters and motivated consultants that like to challenge and stretch themselves.

 
Work remotely, at one of our International offices or onsite with Global customers. Role includes, working directly with clients to transform their business, solve complex business problems, streamline processes and improve quality.
 
Company Overview:
Foresight, an IQVIA company, is a leading Global Provider of Pharmacovigilance (PV) and Risk Management (RM) Solutions which include PV& RM Consulting Services, Hosting & Managed Services and proprietary PV& RM Applications. From business process redesign to technology implementations, all of our services and solutions are delivered with precise, timely, and cost-effective execution to help our clients achieve lower operational costs, minimize potential litigation costs and manage risk.
 
Responsibilities include:
Perform and oversee structured analysis of client’s existing operations to identify pain points, inefficiencies and any unmet business needs
Develop innovative ideas to transform the client’s business, leveraging technology, best practices, and regulatory knowledge in collaboration with Foresight colleagues and clients
Implement new business processes and organizational changes while minimizing disruption to day-to-day business operations
Design and implement measures to ensure oversight and sustainability
Own individual project deliverables in support of business transformation
Support or lead client workshops in support of business transformation
Contribute directly to and oversee creation of high-quality deliverables

Job Description
Technical Solutions Sales Representative - Analytics Center of Excellence
Join us on our exciting journey!

IQVIA is The Human Data Science Company, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward. IQVIA has approximately 55,000 employees in more than 100 countries, all committed to making the potential of Human Data Science a reality, and we are actively hiring.

Reimagine healthcare with us
At IQVIA, you will have the opportunity to build your career, while helping our customers drive human health outcomes forward. We dedicate our experience, resources and reputation so that you can drive your career and choose the path that best defines your development and success.

The Technology Solutions division of IQVIA develops, markets, and implements healthcare-focused enterprise software applications to help life sciences customers drive their business from molecule to market.

Position Summary:
This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of an industry leader and have a significant impact on future growth of our Analytics, Insights and Reporting solutions. With the right analytics, our clients can achieve the impossible. As Sales Representative you start to learn will the pharmaceutical and healthcare industry. We will assist in acclimating you to our internal and client sales & business processes.
You will manage accounts; generate deep/wide relationships with key decision makers at the prospects and clients you are assigned.

Responsibilities:
Serve as a consultative technology sales representative
Present IQVIA’s overall value proposition with a specific focus on our portfolio of technology solutions which include analytics, insights, business intelligence (BI) & reporting.
Proactively build deep and strategic relationships at high levels within the accounts
Assure the execution of strategic account plans
Lead client prospecting, site presentations, negotiations, contract development and account business reviews with key stakeholders.
Utilize CRM to document actions regarding planning and sales activities (ie, sales calls, customer events, opportunities, e-marketing campaigns) and shares account intelligence with internal members during account strategy meetings

Participate in preparing Requests for Information (RFIs) and Requests for Proposals (RFPs) and be responsible to ensure they are completed in a timely and accurate manner
Keep well-informed of assigned industry trends, technological and process changes, new developments, services and other general information related to the assigned accounts and market scope
Provide required status reporting and updates to management
Demonstrate a high level of personal accountability
Proven achiever

Education & Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree
Desire to learn the pharmaceutical market place and commercial operations processes.
Understanding of technology with a passion to add analytics, business intelligence (BI) & reporting solutions to your skill set
Minimum of 2 years progressively-responsible sales experience. You have exceeded quota. You have been a difference maker.
Skilled in negotiations and sales techniques
Demonstrated success accessing your market, the major players and decision makers.
Ability to confidently interact with senior management and executives both internally and externally
Exhibit solid communication skills; ability to present accurate and compelling presentations
Well-developed business acumen
Computer literate

Job Description:
Must have at least 5 years of clinical data review experience in Clinical Research, review protocol and CRF designs. Adequate knowledge of FDA requirements in narrative writing.

Job Responsibilities:
Abstracts all necessary information from CIOMS and recognize data discrepancies in Clinical Database. Performs reconciliation of safety report and clinical patient profile. Post queries for relevant information from safety report to be added in the clinical database. May require narrative writing for clinical data review profile.

Quantitative analysis Performs a comprehensive review for the all SAE data but not limited to reported and coded terms. Completes brief description of clinical cases for clinical data review utilizing the autogenerated narratives.

Qualitative analysis Ensures all relevant information is captured in clinical database and provides quality, clinically meaningful narratives.

Performs all duties according to company policy and regulations and guidance. Performs other duties assigned by the Director or Sr. Manager. No travel required.

QUALIFICATIONS:
Graduate of adequate health care related course with commensurate experience in use of dictionaries in Clinical trial setting and have performed clinical data review.
Minimum of 5 years of AE/SAE data review in Clinical Research.
Strong knowledge of ICH guideline, or adequate background of pathogenesis of disease
Knowledge of INFORM, J -review is a plus and/or other Clinical trial Systems
Proficiency on all related regulations, GCP, and Good Clinical DM Practice
Computer proficiency and knowledge of medical terminology
Expertise on use of Microsoft applications, e.g word document, power point, excel
Strong oral and written communication skills.

Join us on our exciting journey!

IQVIA is The Human Data Science Company, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. We offer a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward. At IQVIA each team member has the opportunity enable our customers to drive human health outcomes forward, while building a career path that is unique to their own passions.
We are currently seeking to significantly expand our IQVIA Technologies Global Training Organization
Our Global Training Organization is responsible for designing, developing and delivering product and technology training for internal sales, delivery and support employees, external partners and customers. We are looking to build a team of creative, innovative curriculum and instructional designers, project managers, instructors, platform and process experts. We have positions open in the US (East Coast), London, Bangalore and virtual. If you like a fast-paced, software environment that will challenge you and develop your skills, then this is an opportunity for you.
As a certification manager on our team, you will specialize in developing and maintaining a certification process. A certification is like a mini-product in that there is a detailed behind-the-scenes process to research, develop, launch and maintain the exam, to ensure our audiences are learning course material and are appropriately qualified to either sell, deliver or use our technologies.
Specifically, you will:
Using industry-best practices, develop, launch and maintain a certification program and exams
Collaborate across the training organization, including Curriculum Design, Instructional Design and Training Instruction to draft certification exams
Synthesize and utilize feedback to ensure relevant exam content that include applicable learning outcomes
Develop standards for storing certifications and an ongoing process for maintaining certifications with consideration for ongoing product updates
Stay current on certification and learning tools, trends and ideas
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in human resources, instructional design, or training and development or a related field
Familiarity with the certification industry
Basic understanding of statistics (e,g, bell curve, normal distribution, etc.)
Experience creating written content with the help of subject matter experts
5 years program management experience
Experience with both live (ILT, Virtual) or asynchronous (eLearning) learning modalities
Skilled at using multiple training software applications
Ability to use and learn new multimedia technology & authoring tools
Demonstrated knowledge of adult learning theory and application
Creative ability to express complex topics clearly and concisely, in an engaging manner that will resonate with each audience as they partake in the exam
Excellent organization / project management skills and the ability to advance multiple initiatives simultaneously
Ability to multi-task, flexibly prioritize projects, and respond to feedback
Experience in a Sales and/or technical field a plus
Knowledge of Healthcare/Life Sciences Industry and/or SaaS Technology a plus
Experience in instructional design and/or delivering training instruction a plus

job_description:
When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. Our $9.5B annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.

Our Asset and Wealth Management division is driven by innovators like you who are driven to create technology solutions that make us work more efficiently and help our businesses grow. It’s our mission to efficiently take care of our clients’ wealth, helping them get, and remain properly invested. Across 27 cities, our team of 4,600 agile technologists thrive in a cloud-native environment that values continuous learning using a data-centric approach in developing innovative technology solutions.
We are seeking a hands-on Senior Software Engineer who can actively contribute to our growing WM data visualization and Business Intelligence platform for client onboarding. Client onboarding and maintenance are the first touch points that’s significantly drive the overall customer interactions and experience. This is also one of the most regulated and audited area. It’s a very delicate balance between creating best possible customer experience without losing sight of environments and regulations we work in. Our platform serves and distributes the data to consumers for all our business critical applications such as various in-house advisor, investor facing tools as well as auditors. This data gets used to drive complex analytics to examine performance, profitability , new business opportunities as well as regulatory compliance.
This individual will be involve in all aspects of above and will be expected to help design, build and extend this platform further. They will need to work closely with data providers and data modelers to understand the data and its business criticality. Platform is also a pioneer in many ways, so will be driving strategy working with design authorities at the same time will be mentoring other teams who are following similar architecture path.

This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:
BS/BA degree or equivalent experience
Expertise in application, data and infrastructure architecture disciplines
Advanced knowledge of architecture, design and business processes
Proficiency in modern programming languages
Keen understanding of financial control and budget management
Ability to work collaboratively in teams and develop meaningful relationships to achieve common goals
Hands on experience in developing and mentoring team of developers working on various data visualization technologies ( QlikSense, NPrint, Tableau etc).
Extensive experience in developing and managing cloud based RESTful APIs, using moneta boot and java.
Extensive experience in traditional as well as modern databases ( Sybase, Oracle, Hadoop, Mongodb etc) and data virtualization technologies.
Proficiency in building simple interfaces using javascript preferably AangularJS.
Apply latest DevOps concepts to continuously improve and transform platform into a highly available, highly maintainable platform – including but not limited to code, policy, processes, behaviors, tools.

Job Description
Join us on our exciting journey! IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.

Description

Purpose:

The Director, Quality Assurance is responsible for serving as a strategic partner to external customers and internal project teams to drive GCP and PV quality, ensuring that that projects and deliverables are compliance with regulatory requirements and industry best practices This is a highly visible and important position within QA and requires both strategic vision and personal tactical execution.

Summary of Responsibilities:
Collaborates with Quality counterparts at customers and with internal project teams to proactively promote, support and facilitate proactive quality through the identification and management of risks and implementation of quality improvement activities.
Provides actionable insights from quality and operational data analysis and proactively working with the customer and the account team to develop action plans to drive continuous improvement. 
Analyzes trends in quality issue reporting and timeliness to ensure adherence to quality issue management requirements across project teams 
Supports the management and resolution of significant issues relating to quality;
In collaboration with Quality Management, ensures projects are inspection ready starting at the design stage.
Drives inspection readiness activities for the customer, including contributing to mock inspections by/of the customer
Contributes to the development of the global risk-based internal audit plan.
Advises customer Quality counterparts on the strategy for regulatory inspections and collaborates in the preparation for and management of inspections at customer offices and, as necessary, at investigator sites.
Prepares for and actively participates in relevant Governance/partnership level meetings e.g. Quality Councils/ Joint Operations Committee (JOC) or equivalent meetings with customer Quality counterparts.
Interfaces with senior management to discuss quality and compliance issues
Interfaces with business development and operations to identify business opportunities
Hosts and/or supports customer audits and ensures appropriate and sustainable action plans are developed and implemented.

Team work is their number one priority, for both local and global teams. They encourage different teams to work together to help foster a better working environment. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who enjoys collaboration and working within the financial industry.

This candidate will create and implement highly scalable and reliable distributed data architectures using core Java, Apache Cassandra, Apache Spark, Apache Hadoop & open source technologies, including data distribution networks to deliver data into the data services layer and API components.

Determine technical approaches to be used, and defining the appropriate methodologies
Communicate technical analyses, recommendations, status, and results to project management team.

Skills:

Bachelor's Degree in IT/Computer Science; Masters Degree preferred
5+ years hands-on experience with Apache Cassandra and Cassandra Data Modeling (conceptual, logical and physical data modeling).
5+ years in managing and configuring Apache Cassandra (DSE) clusters.
Experience with at least two programming languages such as Java, Python or Scala.
Experience working with distributed systems technologies and distributed computing frameworks.
Working knowledge of development toolkits like Maven, GIT, SBT, Continues Integration suites, automated deployments, JIRA, Wiki.
Proficient in Cassandra APIs, tools to import variety of data formats like CSV, Excel, JSON, XML.
Strong understanding of CQL, Data Modeling in-order to achieve highly performant data access.

Hands-on experience of programming with Java, Python, Scala, SQL, CQL
Experience building microservices using Spring Boot
Strong hands-on experience with Linux/Unix
Experience building data pipelines, data catalog, metadata management and lineage
Experience with Data Science workbench such as DataIku or Domino Lab is nice to have
